Sg_BvnTHsbc1AABiJjaiPA.review_text: Badass bar for good drinks, super strong.. I hear their burger is good so will have to return for that. I love the bartenders, they're so much fun!! Outside patio for diners.

9FOrsYpBwOIHvTzqBpe0Qw.review_text: I can't wait to try out the lanes here! We got here a little late on a Tuesday, but it was still pretty crowded, so no bowling for us. Still, we enjoyed a good meal and some good wine.

3LhKzTf4hRTc6NWtFEU1_A.review_text: The best. Food and cocktails are incredible- no exaggeration - and if you enjoy bowling all the better. Can't recommend this place enough- dare I say its's a sure thing? Yes.

doqM5t20UrhPe2K8VF2ixw.review_text: As you might expect, the primary focus here is the bowling. However, the food is, as you would expect, exemplary. I loved everything and I'll definitely be back.  The service that night, left something to be desired. They were training someone new but, I don't think she had served before. Who cares though! It's the best burger in town! Well, in the top 5 anyway.

RQR-bncvVssevK_WIPWvCA.review_text: We went to MBC for a friend's birthday. The food was great, pitchers of beer plentiful, and bowling super-fun. I loved the small size of the place, it felt like we took over the place, even though there were other people there.  Also, the animations during bowling are hilariously cheesy. Wait too long to take your turn - the "hurry up" message is super cute.

ijWQ0R9ra0KF1IGNbhkODQ.review_text: The Mission Bowling Club was a lot better than I expected. I came with a hungry group of friends, so we were able to eat a lot of things together. The food here has a lot of flavor and is well cooked. It's a bit on the fried and greasy side. That's my only complaint.  Corn Nuts - Crunchy. Paired really well with alcohol. It's a good snack to have out on the bar.   Green Chili Cheese Fries - The green chili and pork was really delicious. Other than that, fries are fries.   Fried Chicken - Really good! Crispy on the outside, warm and tender on the inside. It's what all fried chicken should be like.   Salmon - Delicious! I felt that this was the healthier dish and so I was really pleased. Trust me, just order it and try!  Mission Burger - Juicy and with lots of flavor.   In conclusion the food seems to come first at this bowling alley because it was really excellent.

xyhIboKojc_HfOAVO7Egfg.review_text: LOVE BOWLING!!!  You would have never expected this place to be a bowling alley. Outside looks like a warehouse!! They have outdoor seating, not that it's a bad thing. They have a bar on the left of the front door and tables for diners on the right. 6 bowling lanes and 6 couches. Couches are pretty comfortable. Service was wonderful. Everyone there was very nice and helpful.  Food was delicious. The burger was thick and juicy but the grilled onions were a little mushy. The fries with the aioli sauce was AMAZING!! The fried chicken... wasn't as big of a hype. Dipped it in the ranch and I just wasn't feeling the urge to get more. The brownies were delicious.  Had a few cocktails. Didn't like the 3 I tried... but my friends enjoyed theirs.  I gave 3 stars because I thought it was A-OK, not really a fan.

lxOcZ1VZ58nSCFgcunecjw.review_text: I unfortunately was out of town when my wife and group of friends had dinner here a few months ago so I was excited to come back on the weekend during family time with my wife and son.  We rented a lane for an hour and while it's not cheap it's a great place and atmosphere.  The lanes don't seem to be 100% legit but after you bowl a bit you get to understand how they roll.  I was one away from 200 on my final game too so I can't complain.  They make some cool cocktails at the bar as well.  I look forward to coming back and trying some food and breaking 200 :)

d1ZxMYrgFTSMfa0pARbjkA.review_text: Oh their chicken sandwich is good.  Unique slaw they put on top.  Their fires were okay but they were fry pieces vs. long normal sized fries.  Maybe they were running out.  They have my favorite beer on draft so I will certainly be back.  Wish their prices were lower but it is SF.  One of the owner's is really cool and fun to talk to.  It does get loud in there so it is nice to sit on the patio and chill.

Vf3DJncooLUHWYele0Cxrw.review_text: Ok - bowling here is stupid expensive.  I mean like for that kinda cash I should be able to rent 5 lanes.  Then again, peeking at the average score...this crowd ain't pro.  That said, the food here is really tasty and they have a lovely covered patio. So I like.

2TIY4PUb9oyBWn2vmLKy5w.review_text: It was such an interesting place! It's small but a very nice facility.  There are only 5 bowling lanes so make sure you make a reservation if you want to bowl! It's hipster culture at its finest.  The food was really really good.  Probably one of the best cheeseburgers ever! And the fries were extra crispy with a delicious aioli .    The only complaint is that we reserved 3 lanes for 2 hours; I guess our reservation was at 3, but we didn't check in til 3:10.  Cut off at 5 - charged for the full 2 hours.  I guess it's fair since we had the lanes from 3-5, and with so little lanes, it makes sense that they'd be strict about it.  But it's just not ideal.

BYQNUm_Mzomjz7vC9AmmJA.review_text: I love the bowling set up and the bar, but the restaurant space and food leaves something to be desired. The design is off for one. It's almost like they didn't know what to do with the space. I would have created an open casual space with big communal tables to drink, eat and watch the bowling.  The food is only OK and should just be billed as upscale bar food. The cocktails are delicious, but their wines are not the best, nor is the burger. It is NOT the best burger in town. Seriously.   GO for the Bowling and drinks (hence 3 stars) !! But eat elsewhere!

IUXmQbiQSG97Aez2rOKmcQ.review_text: Love the casual trendy ambiance. The staff is nice and helpful. My buddy pulled a faux pas and brought in outside food but the waitress was nice about it after we apologized!  Had the Fried Chicken and it was just so delicious! A pitcher of PBR was pretty cheap and the we paid for the lanes/shoes per hour. We got to pick our names and they all had to be 5 characters so we of course took the liberty to choose the most awkward/vulgar/awful names possible. Gave the guy at the desk a chuckle i think--i'm glad he had a good sense of humor!  We forgot to make a reso (*Cough* it wasn't me who forgot *cough*) but they were understanding and tried their best to accommodate us! I love that this place accepts reservations!  I would pick Mission Bowling Club over the chaotic 80% night club 20% bowling alley that is Lucky Strikes almost any day!   Tips: -weekdays are less busy (DUH) -get the fried chicken! -bring cash so that they only have to charge one card--I don't think they require only one card, but I can only imagine how annoying it is to have to split a bill 6 ways every time! -Bring socks! -Give yourself enough time to eat first if you want--you cant eat in the bowling area.

OJyy3jYZecJBKsB_zCFgrQ.review_text: I had to wait a couple of days to write this review.   My little girl decided that she wanted a bowling party for her birthday. I made reservations a month in advance, paid cash up front for three lanes, two with bumpers for the kids, one lane for the parents. We needed to accommodate a large group of more than 15. Including running an open bar tab, and shoe rentals.  When we arrived to set up for the 2 o'clock party, no one there knew what was going on. They had made other reservations on our lanes, had no clue as to who the party was for, or how many to expect. We got our lanes at 2:20 after much complaining.   We were not well received, and staff/ owners, there are about 5 or so, hovered and complained about any and everything! Even though, I spent several hundred dollars.   I found Mission Bowling Club to be snooty and pretentious when it comes to us locals.  After I posted this, I received a call from one of the owners. She said that she was hoping to maybe work it out and maybe I would reconsider my negative review. I decided to give her my ear.   Unfortunately, she said that there are always two sides to a negative review, she was commenting on some food that a parent had made to share at the party. I had no problem paying a fee for that. She claimed that we left bad tastes in each others mouths. Really?  I suggested they take heed of the negative reviews. When multiple customers complaints take on the same tone. Try to fix it. Try not to repeat it!

76Y70W2mfSaI_XzU3gF8Xw.review_text: What is not to love? Killer brunch, yummy cocktails, fun activities like bowling and local art viewing, adorable staff. MBC for the win! xo

6lw2Qs2AW-e8ue2uKXZj3g.review_text: I love this place. While I can see giving it less than five stars (the service at the lanes could be faster, it gets crowded in the evening hours on the weekends), I get so excited about going that it doesn't dampen my enthusiasm. Mission Bowling Club is great in the afternoons and early evenings when there is less competition for a lane. The bar makes excellent cocktails. I haven't tried any of the food yet, however. The people working the lane area are curteous. I do think an hour works out to slightly closer to 50 or 55 minutes considering setup, but I've had mixed experiences with this and sometimes it seems closer to an hour. I think an hour is not enough time and would personally opt for two, which is the maximum, but either way is fun. If you are reserving a lane online, be aware that reservations can't be made same day. Be prepared for the other patrons to watch you bowl, which might bother our less skilled brothers and sisters at first, but nothing ever seems to be in bad spirits. Overall, this is a must activity for groups of 4-6 looking for a fun as a group.

cfVDBmjnlY2iJaBqz7D2Ng.review_text: Possibly one of the best chicken and waffles I've ever had!! It was more like chicken and deep fried corn bread, but I'm not complaining. The chicken was really good with their chili sauce and the waffles were AMAZING with the maple butter. I'm not a big butter fan, so I asked for the butter on the side so that the waffle wouldnt be drenched in the butter. I was surprised at how maple-y the butter was-- it was like solidified maple syrup and it went perfect with the waffle. I can't get over how good the waffle was.   The wait staff was also really nice. Me and my boyfriend were like an hour late to our brunch/bowling reservation but they were really cool about it. Overall, I would definitely be back for the food (the bowling is kinda pricey unless you have a big group since they charge by lane).

yh8_9Ix1wp9dekvyOZbilQ.review_text: When I first heard of the concept of this place, I had to admit I rolled my eyes a little bit. It just sounded too manufactured hipster to be true, simply a Lucky Strike with some thick rimmed glasses thrown on top. But I have to say that after experiencing it firsthand I was completely won over!   I was about to give it four stars because they don't have very many lanes, and because only 6 people can bowl at a time. But I now realize that though it might not be the most convenient for large parties, that's actually what makes this place so great. The space isn't huge and it feels intimate, and the smaller numbers allow the staff to be fully attentive and friendly to everyone. So be warned!   The other thing to note is that you can't order food at the bar and restaurant and bring it to where you're bowling. So make sure to leave time to try their food and drinks (which are delish, read on for more on that) before your game starts.   They're known for their burger and understandably so, but I also very much enjoyed the smaller and healthier seared scallop dish I had. It was so well made and tasty - you would never ever think you were eating it in a bowling alley! They also have fancy cocktails, or pitchers of beer if that's more your thing.   Overall my friends and I had such a fabulous time here, and were super impressed by the quality of the food, the service of everyone from the bartenders to the bouncers, and the cute ambiance of the place. I highly recommend it!

XmEywucVDyUP9VJ4SXGjzw.review_text: From the outside Mission Bowling Club is so declasse that you know it is going to be chic.  And it is.   And the food is much too good for a bowling alley.  Even better, rather than the menu telling you that they are adding to the check because of the San Francisco health care mandate, something restaurants must and should do, here some of your bill goes to help the needy.  That makes the good food they serve very tasty indeed.  I started with fried chicken and paired it with four bean salad.  Good and very good.  Plain and simple.  And for the price a steal.  The vaunted Mission burger that I ordered medium rare came well done.  Too bad.  But it was good anyway, because the balance of onions, cheese and beef was perfect.    I have a theory that if you don't eat the potato sticks (probably from a can) that come with the burger, then the burger becomes calorie free.  Try for yourself and see.  And the wine pour (I got a glass for the resveratrol) was generous.    Go, live long, and be happy.

jEkr6g8zL9TkLQz9kuHZWw.review_text: Oh dear. What happened? The first time I ate here, several months ago, it was absolutely amazing. This past Monday (mid January 2014) it was a complete disaster.   The menu was revised and the only thing that was good was the drink. I am pretty easy to please, so this is saying something.  Mussels and bone marrow: No perceivable bone marrow, but otherwise palatable.  Baby greens salad: completely ruined by way too much extremely salty salad dressing. We sent it back, it came back less drenched, but still overly salty.   Then we waited over half an hour for our entrée, so finally we paid the bill and had them put it in a box to go. This was the porkchop, which was a good-looking piece of meat with some nice veggies, but again it was incredibly salty. Now, I like salt, but this was pucker your mouth salty!*  They appreciated that we were extremely unhappy, and let us know that they were retraining some people in the kitchen. Thankfully, they comped our drinks and salad. The servers were obviously distressed over what was going wrong in the kitchen, so we left a nice tip.  I won't be going back for a while, until they get their stuff straightened out. This is a great little place that seems to be going through a rough patch.  * all was not lost; I took it home and used the fatty parts like pancetta. :-)

WVljAjviZwY4Y3oYC1Qw_Q.review_text: My preconceived ideas of this place were blown away! At first I laughed at the concept - boutique bowling? But MBC won me over. Such a fun way to spend a Saturday night.  This has got to be the cleanest, best designed bowling alley I've been to. Gone are the bright fluorescent lights, tacky disco ball, and uncomfortable fiberglass seats. Instead, pendant lights, Public Bicycle posters, and leather couches (which they wipe down in between each group session!).  The staff and crowd were unpretentious and nice and laid back. Fairly inexpensive pitchers of beer with great service to clean up your empties. The windows looking into the kitchen was a plus - watching the cooks make juicy burgers was so distracting from my poor bowling game.

JKIkdVqAJLEXTq92gF98bA.review_text: Only 69 reviews?  Surprising!  I thought people would be all over this place.. Before one of my friends moved across the country for med school, a few of us got together for one last boys night out to send him off right.  After all, since we weren't at Mission Bowling Club to do any actual bowling, what better way to send off a future doctor by loading him up with fried food, burgers, and beer? After starting off with a pitcher of beer, we ordered the Home Fries and Fried Chicken appetizers to share and a round of the Mission Burgers for everyone.  The Home Fries were pretty good (yelp.com/biz_photos/hEXh…), and I liked how they were lightly fried and seasoned.  They tasted even better with the aioli, but I wouldn't say the dish was amazing.  Solid, but not amazing.  The Fried Chicken, on the other hand, came highly recommended by one of my friends and it was easy to see why (yelp.com/biz_photos/hEXh…).  The breading was thin and crispy, and the meat at the center was moist and tender.  I thought the ranch dipping sauce was a little heavy on the dill, but not terrible. Now as good as the appetizers were, the burger was definitely the star (yelp.com/biz_photos/hEXh…).  All of us were fans, and one of my friends even claimed it was the best he's had in SF.  Although I'm not sure I would go that far, it's definitely one of the better ones I've had in the city.  The meat was very well seasoned, the patty was juicy, and the grilled onions were a great addition.  Lots of flavor all around.  The only part of the dish I wasn't big on had nothing to do with the burger - I would have preferred regular fries instead of shoestring, but that's just me. Despite its somewhat inconvenient location to where I live, I know I'll be back at some point to both eat and bowl.  Other nearby alleys might have more lanes (MBC only has six), but I'm pretty sure none of them can offer the same chill atmosphere, a full service bar with several unique beers on tap, AND great food.  Even if there's likely to be a wait, that's one hell of a burger to help pass the time!

UySLQuZU6SOuuMO4J74x7w.review_text: Too bad they don't have more lanes (only 6).  Clean and nice venue, good food, full bar.

WPBrjBbk76ZtZQ8QpG09cQ.review_text: Great place for group events.  Having drove and walked by numerous times, I've finally had a chance to visit this place in person! We were a group of 6, played for about an hour, got a pitcher of beer, and ended up paying about $13 each including shoe rentals. Not bad for mission standards.  Plus, the atmosphere was great, with nice decoration in the entrance, nice clean lanes, a clean bar with lots of beer selection, clean couches, and in general a cool, relaxed vibe where everyone can go and have fun.  Since I went at night, I was hoping for the neon "cosmic" bowling theme to show up like they do at other places, but alas, cannot ask for too much :)  In general, a nice, chill, cool place to host events and bring groups!

jvAFUKSG2cUJeA95_OVTfw.review_text: I was here last Saturday pretty late celebrating my birthday with some friends and we had a great time. I looked this place online and decided to go. The food was awesome and the service was even better.  It feels like an exclusive place when your there because there is only 6 lanes which in a sense feels like your in a bowling club. I want to thank Michelle who was a great help to me and my friends as well as Fred who played some James Brown as requested by me up until closing time. Will definitely come back on my next visit to the city.

NnzhHARuS94VzVQ-WqIdxw.review_text: 4 stars for a killer bar (especially with Susan running it), beautiful interior, and awesome front patio. It's an awesome, fun place to spend time with a big group. The staff is so friendly and happy to help.  I knocked one star off for the expensive prices for bowling. It's very costly to party here... make it worthwhile!

pRDdcScJUj6lA60rFUH1VA.review_text: The hype around the burger brought me there. The place is awesome (the first hipster bowling I have ever seen), the burger is good, the fries are incredible. I'll come back and try to get a lane this time.

w8tSXcAF5yO4MiE9dDnLwg.review_text: Great place to grab a seat at the bar and get some tasty cocktails and appetizers. Can't go wrong with the fried chicken on stick, and a Paloma to drink!

cCPjASKs5YpMB4BmN2oSZg.review_text: The concept of bowling, drinking, and eating was underutilized in SF until the last couple years. Now there are various competitors around the city. Mission Bowling Club is more approachable and serves better food.   We came here for a birthday party, and the guest of honor always chooses solid venues for great people to meet.   Get your drink on - the beer list here really sticks out. For food, I can vouch for the excellent jerk pork shoulder sandwich, the really good burger, and the fried chicken. If we don't plan on bowling then plenty of the non-finger food dishes look compelling.   Pro move: Eat and drink only with your left hand and bowl only with your right. The only thing in this place than the bowling balls are the bowling balls' holes, of course.

jhPAC7UyPiRFNPlNQYMMXg.review_text: Bowling, decent food, and a nice bar in the middle of the Mission? Pretty sweet!   I threw my friend's bachelor party here (No, I did not bring strippers or blow into the bowling alley). They were more than accommodating when I was planning this event, and they made the whole experience painless to organize! We all had a great time here!

aZNC53EYiGJAECV7_FZgKQ.review_text: One word: Disappointed. This is now the 4th time in a row that I arrived here only to find that they were closed for a private event. The first time that I was rejected, I didn't check their calendar ahead of time so, I will give them a pass for denying me entry due to their "private event." But, for the second, third AND fourth time, I had diligently checked their calendar online ahead of time on the DAY OF, and was happy to find that they did not have a private event going on that day. Each of those times, I arrived at this joint only to find out that they will be "closed at 5:30pm for a private event." And the most recent time I was denied entry was on a Wednesday afternoon. Ok. Then why didn't you update your calendar to reflect this closure? Your calendar said you were wide open. I had even checked the calendar on your freakin'  website no less than 2 hours before I arrived and the coast was apparently clear -- your website did NOT mention being closed for a private event. Each time, for THREE TIMES IN A ROW, I arrived at your doors, only to find out in the last minute that you decided to close your doors for a private event -- AND THIS HAPPENED TO ME THREE TIMES IN A ROW NOW. What a waste of time, even after checking the calendar on your website for availability. My advice to future patrons: Call 30 minutes ahead of time to check their availability because the calendar on their website is NOT reliable -- even on the day of.

l1s_15WpYmi-unlNhaKvMg.review_text: The burger here was delicious and the beer selection ranged broadly from overpriced PBRs to cutesy Japanese brews.   4 stars for food, beer, and service.  Pro-bowlers beware: The rightmost lane keeps bad score.  The number of pins struck were miscounted at almost every turn. :(.   Minus two stars for the broken counter.  Plus one star for the fun indie playlist.    All-in-all, this was a decent hangout spot for a moderately-sized party.

t2Gj1DlQt5xNUIKD90BQ6g.review_text: MBC has consistently been a good experience since my first time. Friendly staff and good food. Luckily it hasn't been so crowded where reservations can make or break your experience. Especially like the brunch here with football on the projector. Loco Moco and chicken and waffles are money.

WVgmvTObpZHvvgzsWRC3bg.review_text: MBC is not your hometown's bowling alley.  It's a terrific venue with creative drinks, food, and atmosphere.  Great staff, great service, and great fun.    It's just that simple.  Build it and then will come.  Find it and settle in.    Get your bowl on.  And to think, I was 'this close', to a high of 151.

riGkQwFY0wWHwsa5HASVbA.review_text: Vibe is great. Drinks are great. Staff is awesome. With reservations backing up until when we're gray and old, it's definitely a good idea to book a lane waayy ahead of time.  The food was less impressive though.   What we ordered: Fried chicken with blue cheese ranch green taco salad with pineapple and avocado chili verde mission burger  Um, I honestly what was going on with the burger. Large and really thick patty over toasted bun, with the standard pickles, lettuce, and tomato on top. One thing I noticed though was that it had no sauce. So far so good right? But one bite in, I realized the meat had less meat texture and more meat loaf consistency. And I do not like my burger patties to be squishy. On top of that, it was incredibly salty to the point of bewilderment whether the seasoning had been an accident or not... Just a no-go on this one for me.  Green taco salad was good. Rolled up into cigars and deep-fried, the taco shells are nice and crunchy. Add the slightly sweet pineapple avocado salsa on top and it softens up nicely. The strong lime juice, though keeping the avocados green and attractive, distracted a bit from all the other flavors. Alright in my book.  Fried chicken came skewered on a stick dangling over a pool of blue cheese ranch dressing. The chicken was fried nicely, with incredibly juicy and tender meat inside. The marinate is oddly sweet and felt more like a dessert than a dish. The ranch also erred on the sour side. Not a fan, but I'm gonna blame this on personal taste.

GvRh9s4sUpSVJYy1U5czKA.review_text: This is really a 3.5 star review, but I mainly wanted to review the food. For all the mentions of the burger in other reviews, I really thought it would be a top-notch burger. It wasn't. It was a lot of meat, but the toppings were thin, mediocre and barely recognizable. The bun wasn't anything special, and the fries -- I would have preferred just normal fries, not shoelace fries.  Would have made this a 3-star review, but the service was solid, atmosphere was great and I loved the indoor bike racks.

zyLIp7DRFqeIE1Grrh3Zng.review_text: Small bowling alley in the Mission, featuring food from the Mission Chinese food team.   The burger has received a lot of press so I had high expectations. Overall a very juicy burger, but a tad undersalted for my taste. The fried chicken suffered the same problem with seasoning but was nice and crispy.  Bowling was fun, but kinda cramped in the 6 lane alley. Good cocktails.

HwxKs9Cu-y87kCIbfFedSA.review_text: Awesome place!  Really great food and reasonably priced at that.  Bowling was super fun as well. Love that the bowling lane chairs were these nice comfy leather couches.  Drinks were solid.  Food was seriously great - we tried deviled eggs, fried chicken (both the appetizer and the sandwich), fried oysters , burger ... I was pleasantly surprised and impressed.

Jl7wukjs3Y0WSQOQQ1vkgw.review_text: Bowling is great. Good food is even better. What happens when you have both? Mission Bowling Club! The lanes are pretty pricey, and they fill up fast. The plush leather upholstery is a nice touch though. If you don't get to play, the food and drinks alone are worth the trip.  The mission burger is a serious burger. And by serious, I mean serious. The 1/2 lb. patty is cooked to perfection, with a sear on the outside that gives it a delightful crispy crust and a juicy medium pink center. This is right up my alley as I generally don't like burgers cooked too rare, because instead of having a tender crumbly patty, it becomes mushy and pasty. The burger is also seasoned very well. It's salty enough to make the rich beefiness pop, and the flavor maintains its integrity as it mixes with the grilled onions, cheese, and bun. The only thing that would make this burger better is to slap it on a charcoal grill. It would be divine to have the same crust and juiciness with just a kiss of smokiness.   The jerk pork shoulder sandwich was really good when I first came here. It had big smoky flavor, and the warm spices gave the pork flavor some depth. It reminded me of my own barbeque since I use jerk spices in my rub. Unfortunately, it wasn't as smoky the last time I ordered it. Too bad...  Don't forget the home fries if you're here for brunch. They have a light but very crispy exterior, and the inside is nice and soft. I also really enjoy that there's rosemary to add an extra herby flair.  Bowling + Good Food = Duh Winning

wo38nW_JbXC4m_zlaN86wQ.review_text: I rate this place 3.5 stars because my dish was very delicious.  I had the summer rataouiie.  It came with eggplant, and squash on top of polenta.  The polenta had a tasty flavor to it.  The only problem I had with my food was that the portion was smaller than I expected and I was still hungry after licking the bowl clean.  The reason why I'm rating this place 3.5 stars is because my boy-friend orderd a burger with no onions and when the server brought it over, he again asked if the burger was without onions and the server said it didn't have any.  Well, this burger had onions and he said it was so salty it tasted like someone dropped the whole salt container in.  The fries the burger came with were really good.  It tasted like they were fresh and not previously frozen.  The server we had was very nice.  (She wasn't the one who brought over the burger with the onions.)  Overall, I had an enjoyable time.  My food was yummy.  I just wish there was more of it and it's too bad the burger came with onions and tasted like salt rock.

thN6J0phXSgzbwmjjwYQWA.review_text: This place was really fun!  I haven't bowled in many years, and as a work team building event, it was perfect.    It's a small, swanky, 21+ alley, with just a few lanes, and the shoes weren't that gross!  We reserved three lanes, so there was no wait, and they kept the food and drinks coming the entire time.  The mule was fabulous... I think I had 4 of them, and the food choices were upscale versions of what you'd typically see in a bowling alley.  Burgers (including a vegan version), corn dogs (w/ sausage), and a variety of fried apps and salads.  My biggest learning was that I'm a terrible bowler, but I still had a great time with my colleagues.

Z0yHptbS93271s_h6LJOMw.review_text: HUGE thank you to mbc for helping me make my boyfriend's surprise birthday party a fun and flawless one!  i was eyeing mbc for my boyfriend's surprise party around thanksgiving and had e-mailed them and turned out everything was pretty much booked up until january (they only have 6 bowling lanes).  i asked nicole from mbc to put us on the wait list and lo and behold, 2 lanes opened up and i snatched them up right away!  from reservation of the bowling alleys and restaurant to service, the mbc team really have service down to a t!  personal thanks to:  nicole:  for putting our party on the waitlist and getting back to us.  being patient with the reservation process even when it's during the thanksgiving holidays! jarrod:  for being our awesome server for our party of 9 and being SO patient with us and getting our food AND drink orders down and letting us split our bill on multiple cards. fred & adrian:  for checking us in for bowling and getting our shoes ready to bowl and accommodating to 5-10 minutes late start as we wrapped up dinner.  mbc isn't cheap, but you really get what you pay for for food, drinks, bowling, music, and service.  there's a $10 cake cutting charge because only the kitchen is allowed to cut the cake.  they will help set up and light the candles and bring out the cake.  expect gourmet delicious grubs from mbc!  everything was SO good!  i got a small bite of everything on the menu and loved them all!  fun times, we can't wait to be back!  thanks again!

ILz8ApVEgTqbv5LnC6PyuA.review_text: Pretty sweet setup, especially if you plan ahead and reserve a lane. Not only is the bowling decent, but so is the bar and the food. The fried chicken was surprisingly great as were the fries and the mushroom fritters. Sure the bowling isn't cheap, but it's fine for a group of six...

FbgqbR_Tr8hTHjYy32KG4A.review_text: Ever seen the episode of Southpark that takes place in San Francisco? If you haven't, you should. This bowling "club" basically epitomizes the stereotype that Trey Parker so brilliantly pointed out in regards to San Francisco; That this town is completely full of itself. I mean, what other city takes something as sacred to American culture as the crusty bowling alley, and turns into a fine dining, wickedly overpriced, nauseatingly hipster experience? The all American bowling alley, complete with its inedible food, piss beer, and tacky decor, has in many respects been at the heart of this great nation. Mission Bowling "Club" has taken this key piece of Americana, and completely sanitized it. I gasp to think what "the dude" would say about this place. Utter sacrilege, and frankly, an assault on  "Merica!

cHdSQISeMpp8HlCWgNb1QQ.review_text: Great place in the mission to grab some drinks and food. I didnt actually bowl so cant really say anything on that front. The staff was friendly and helpful. The food was great! I definitely liked the mission burger! The devilled eggs are also good

u_tsaDmAgGnmOUGdbA2tNg.review_text: "Welcome to your Friday night." When your server opens with that line, you just know your evening's gonna be awesome.  We heard great things about the burger and were very eager to try it. It was well-seasoned, juicy, and a pretty good size. But what really got my attention was the fried chicken appetizer. Perfectly crisp on the outside, moist and tender on the inside, with a tangy ranch dip. It was glorious. I will even go out on a limb and say that it was the best fried chicken I have ever had (and believe me, I've had a LOT of fried chicken). And now, months later, nothing else comes close. It was a decent portion for an appetizer, and at $8, it's a steal. The dirty martini was disappointing, but they had a sizeable enough beer selection to more than make up for it.   I don't go to a lot of bowling alleys, but I think it's safe to say that this is one of the better looking ones out there. The lighting was great -- bright enough so that you could see what you were doing, but not bright enough to ruin the atmosphere and make everyone look ashen. None of that garish fluorescent and neon crap. They had some interesting posters on the walls too. With just six lanes, there was a really long wait, so we didn't get to bowl. Not that I'm broken up about it, since I'm not much of a bowler anyway. It's a fun alternative to the dreary dive bar scene, so I'm glad there are options for a night out without sacrificing your need for good lighting. ;)

dJtrZhOFp7TAF685qc8JjA.review_text: Like drive-in movies, there are too few bowling alleys around. What a great idea, and what a good location.   I went for my friend's birthday tonight, I missed the bowling fun, but I did enjoy the bar. The decor is really welcoming. Everything is pretty hip/modern, and overall really comfortable. The patio in the front is really cute, and again, comfortable.   Sony is the most awesome bartender I have ever come across. Super friendly, and gave us the best drink recommendations. Aviation is my new favorite!    I don't know the name of the guy who was checking ID's tonight, but he also deserves to be part of the good review.   I am already planning a trip back! I heard the food was good, so I'll have to try it.

ljaDy_lIKNWr2MfjV6Mt9w.review_text: A great spot for hanging out with friends and having a good meal. For a bowling alley, it's almost outrageous how good the food is. The restaurant is almost never full but make sure you book in advance in order to be able to reserve a bowling alley. With only a few alleys, it's almost always full!

y_jl-bErj1mnb4KF04F74Q.review_text: I'm excited to host our team event (group of 12). Great vibe. Friendly and helpful staff.

48mOAMtqs3AUgT4OL2UnlA.review_text: Pretty hipster but fun.   There are only 6 lanes so a reservation is necessary. The food is also pretty good and well priced.

NFM0QH6X3vQCsXYry4j63g.review_text: This place is AWESOME!  When I go to "bowling" places there's usually a restaurant/bar inside of the alley.  This place is like the opposite!  A few lanes in a restaurant/bar!  So I came in here with the girly to grab a drink and check the place out.  Upon entering, the place has an outdoor patio area with some pretty cool abstract and natural art.  We sat down at the bar and ordered some local beer from the tap (they try and support local brew!).   Ambiance: There a patio area, inside area for dining and a bar area.  They project sport events along the wall so that was cool.  A little further in, there's 6 bowling lanes with sofas.  Very chill and lounge like!  I love the fusion of bowling-lounge!  Service: The service here was very friendly.  We entered and were immediately greeted by the hostess, though we just grabbed a seat at the bar.  They even have a section of the bar that is lowered, designated for the disabled, which is very thoughtful!  The bartender was very friendly and knowledgeable about the beers and drinks.  Food/Drink: We didn't order any food, but the Bar Harbor drink was awesome abeit a bit pricey ($10).  If the other drinks were like this one then they've got it good.  The food looked like a pretty decent portion and the prices were about average.  Overall, I'd love to come back and chill here with a game or two of bowling!

euZebQQYhgDuUZjBjbIC_Q.review_text: I love this place and wish I loved closer to it.   I went to a meet and greet event tonight here with a group of about 30 people total by the end if the night. The organizer didn't make reservations, but they were super accommodating and have the bartenders a heads up. We stay around the bar area instead of sitting in the areas reserved for dining.  There was a great vibe, I was absolutely feeling it. What sweetened the deal was their great selection of beers. I had the Blind Pig IPA. Delicious. There was also a dark IPA that I will try next time.  $7 for my beer was a little painful, but the great people and awesome atmosphere made up for it.   It's a little far from the bars in Valencia, but still close to BART. A definite winner for hanging out after work over a couple drinks and maybe a game. I'm a fan!

Ve0LUwcrzxL7w0RYgY4Aaw.review_text: Once in a while there's nothing more fun than going bowling with some friends. Growing up in the suburbs it wasn't too hard to find some seedy, stinky bowling alley to hit up for $10-15 a person for a few hours. But living in the city whodathunk someone would come up with the genius idea of putting a small bowling alley right smack in the Mission in SF?  Only open for a week, Mission Bowling Club is already a hotspot in SF. With fantastic cocktails, multiple levels of eating/drinking space and 6 really gorgeous lanes for bowling, this is by far the nicest bowling alley I've ever seen. Forget your Lucky Strikes, MBC might be 1/4 the size but is easily 4x nicer.  Staff was really accommodating and polite and though I didn't eat, I spied a few folks nomming on what looked to be some pretty awesome corn dogs. Can't wait to come back!

K7-zOceF1slgqJTZSKe7YQ.review_text: Boutique Bowling!  This bowling alley is incredibly missionesque- simple but modern and updated, a little new with the old, and yes, there are hipsters.  Lanes here are limited, but there's great food and drinks to indulge in on the side.  This place is a great place for small groups, and fun to hang out at, even if you're not bowling.

s1mD1PvJQrAYHfNG9UDYJw.review_text: My coworkers and I had a fun-filled night here. Everyone ordered the Mission burger (with the exception of one vegetarian who got a vegan burger) and we were all in food heaven! It was one of the best burgers I've had overall, but it is THE best burger I've ever had at a bowling alley. The drinks were no joke either. After two Kingston Mules (basically a Moscow Mule) and a Cooler, we stopped caring that we couldn't bowl for crap.  One thing for sure is that I wouldn't recommend this place to my friends who are "real bowlers" because it costs some serious dough. Our party of five laid out $75 for one game (and I brought my own shoes, so that's one less shoe rental). Still, we walked away with a smile on our faces.

87hSO1uA83c5SQ9x8hoDlA.review_text: So I really do love this place. It is a one stop shop for an evening of fun! We had dinner in their small classing dining area. They have a fully stocked bar and 6 bowling lanes. Dinner was a bit pricey, but you're kind of paying for the ambiance. The food itself was pretty good. Drinks were average price and bowling a bit over average, but its almost like you're own private bowling party so it was totally worth it! We ordered dessert and they brought it close to the lanes so we could bowl and dine! Loved the panicotta and the smores brownie! A definate must try. My friends and I all enjoyed ourselves!!!

TZatgTt9RyYGlBa7uZTgBg.review_text: I didn't even bowl here, just had brunch!  I had the fried chicken and waffles, and the eggs with chips and guac.  Both were exxxtremely delicious!  The chicken was atop a generous amount of chili sauce and the waffles were fluffy and chewy.  The eggs are a good option too, and nothing here is particularly healthy unless you get the side salad, which is a bit dull, but I would guess that every breakfast item is top notch.  MMmmm.

toOht-Wn-X3g30GFpMkP4w.review_text: Interesting place hidden in the Mission! Came here with a group of friends around 4 and the workers here are pretty nice since our entire party wasn't here yet so they started us on the "practice" round even though they were going to be busy. We had an hour reserved for 2 lanes, at the end of the game I checked my time and it wasn't even an hour yet. So I'm not sure if he included the "practice" time into it (which he made it seemed like it wasn't) or... we got jipped 15 minutes! Only 6 lanes, so either come early or make reservations. They're also limited in bowling balls that they have or size/weight you want. I didn't care too much since I don't really consider it a "full blown" bowling alley... otherwise I would have went elsewhere. You don't get to control the screens as much... you basically have to go up to the person up front to add names if you do, which is kind of lame. More of a hangout spot with friends.  Food here, I didn't get to try much. We only got a few appetizers... the fries were really good though. Nice and crunchy. I think it came with an aioli dipping sauce that was smoked... I didn't care too much for it. I preferred the ketchup sadly. lol. But the fries alone were good and seasoned. Also tried the hush puppies... probably won't order this again next time.. nothing special about it and rather boring and bland.  Wish they had more beers on tap, but they still have a pretty good selection of other drinks.  Overall, nice place to just stop by and hang out with some friends. Bowling here can be a bit pricey compared to other places you may be used to... but again, it's more for the socializing aspect and it is in the city... so meh! Will definitely try the burgers next time. I feel kind of schizo since I'm reviewing two separate things... the bowling alley itself... I would give it a 3. The food aspect... a 4. So... I would give them a 3.5 if I could.

wmWni5egGi-ZW1SVAX7XYg.review_text: Very clean and the decor was so nice.  We ordered shoestring fries & the fried chicken! The Fries were delicious...amazing avioli sauce... The Fried chicken was a little oily, but bomb.   We went early because yelpers said it gets busy and they were right. Go early or call in :)

Eypq5gLLjCapBVVnMw_MyA.review_text: Great fried chicken, ok fries (not a fan of the accompanying sauce), and bowling.  That pretty much sums it up. I mean you know it's hipster bowling. Nothing wrong with that. you even get to use a PBR branded ball which probably earned the dude who thought of it a bonus. Capitalism?

4PIcs3X-Ro_KoczDJ3y4ZQ.review_text: great beer, good food, fantastic service, and bowling. somewhat hidden in a barn-ish warehouse in the mission.   ordered the egg sandwich, biscuits and gravy, and their famous mission burger. the portions were generous and very delicious. the home fries were very crispy and flavorful on the outside while the insides were creamy and comforting. the biscuits were fluffy, the savory gravy was thick. the meat in the burgers was fresh and cooked well, however it was cold by the time they were served, and so were their fries that resembled pik nik potatoes. i quickly became envious as i saw a plate of fried chicken pass by, i should have ordered that! our waitresses were very friendly and full of smiles which was pleasant.   the tab for 4 with drinks came out to $90 before tax/tip. and that's before bowling.

QOiZu9pn65H7zR49_DdVdQ.review_text: That's a great burger. Well seasoned. Enjoy the tangy caper aioli on it as well. Wasn't crazy about the bun. Wish it was heated to soften it up. Patty was literally oozing juices as it was set in front of me. Points for that.

P5bUL3Engv-2z6kKohB6qQ.review_text: I totally forgot that you can get the Mission Burger which was once sold at Duc Loi Supermarket down the way here. Great patty, cheese, soft bread. However they seemed to not have the pickle to cut through the salt and fat, which is key. THe piece of lettuce was a bit sad too but we showed up right before close of kitchen. The "chili cheese" fries they had were pork shoulder with cotia in a nice sauce. I could have made that my dinner. Watched folks bowl a few rounds but was never enticed to go toss hard balls myself :)

PMmDYnKwGKTzPr7qyr4CFw.review_text: I have never been here for an actual round of bowling but it does look like fun except I'm usually too busy stuffing my face with their delicious chicken and waffles. I mean could it get any better on a Sunday morning!?   If you're in the neighborhood stop by and try the Mission Burger! Aged to perfection.   To rinse it down, I recommend the honey bee cocktail if you're a vodka drinker like myself but they also have a shit ton of beer to choose from if you aren't!

8wT-FkHPs6bmEvLG5GawIw.review_text: Bad service sums it up.  We were charged for a drink we didn't receive. We got that taken off. We waited an hour and when we checked in they said they thought we had cancelled. We waited twenty minutes for a server and then finally got one after I got up to find one. Our drinks got forgotten and/or brought out after another twenty minutes. The servers were rude and slow.  The food was maybe three stars, ham on the croque madam was too salty. The burger was ordered medium rare and served medium well.

WecuAsHBDZGj7Z6_sJcQAw.review_text: Strike.  Three star score: 144 average, 200 remains elusive.  Four star brunch: Two large slices of fruit compote topped French toast were delicious. Bite of my friend's bacon and egg sandwich was outstanding.  Five star scene: Old warehouse renovated into a six lane bowling mecca. Wood tables with pin for legs. Balls stored in iron racks. Leather couches. Vintage signage.  Hourly rates range from $35 to $55 depending on day of week and time of day. We had time to bowl four games in an hour. Absolutely worth it.  Super popular for a reason. Mission Bowling Club bowls a 300.

XzG908fzJ3vtHUaTrLKr2w.review_text: Awesome food and service. Perfect burgers and cocktails.

kBogzjf4Okfi4_EQUkfZSw.review_text: This was a super fun place to check out. We were there with about 20 people in our party and they were very accommodating. First we hung out in the bar area and had some drinks and food. The hubs and I tried the chicken sandwich with a margarita and beer. Yum! Next our group had reserved two lanes to bowl for two hours. We had a blast!  Staff was super friendly and the food came out quick, even with all of the people that were there. I would definitely go back.

OtA3JyBtxjl-Wo3l_iWmzQ.review_text: Amazing experience with full buyout! Company holiday party with about 85 people. Karaoke, photo booth, bowling, kids crafting, movie area and popcorn, glittery centerpieces.....and the staff handled it all with ease. They were incredibly helpful the entire evening and helped keep the pace. The drinks were excellent, the food was excellent. Fun was had by all. I propose we have our holiday party there every year! Thanks MBC!!!

uMLAo3ALUySWisGSlWX93g.review_text: - The decor was fancy hipster.  I liked it alot.  Perfect spot to have a date night!  - I didn't go bowling here, but it looked like the peeps bowling were having a great time.  I went here to eat and draaaank.  FOOD - Burger is a 7.5/10 - it tastes great, but nothing that blew my mind away (like Father's Office in LA).  - Fries were really good too. I'd eat those fries all day long yo!  - A friend ordered their ginger beer and it was de-freakin-licious.  - The highlight (for me) of the venue is their beer list.  They have great breweries like Russian River on their list.    - Parking is easy to find on the street.  - Service was great!   - I'd definitely come back again

UQFE3BT1rsIYrcDvu_XVow.review_text: I guess I can finally review this place... or should I say, my favorite new place in San Francisco, as everyone is finding out about it.   I've been here about a dozen times for everything from Birthdays to Burner parties to Brunch (bottomless mimosas plus bowling balls equals brilliance by the way) and I've had a ball every time.  Love the cocktails (Molly, you rock).  Love the house-made ginger mix.  Love the food (ahi tuna, corn dogs, and the that chicken dinner especially)   Love the brunch (crab benedict, chicken and waffles, french toast with sides on a big plate for shared dipping, and chilequilles with the pork)  Thanks for making bowling "cool" again. (first time since the 50s I think). I really missed it.

_if5711_QFV-vwAuhwBH9g.review_text: Look I want to write a good review for this place..I love this place in some ways. I love coming here on a Saturday or a Sunday day and eating in the outside cage area. But it is a bowling alley, and my review is for what the place represents itself as: a bowling alley.  I get here at 8:15 on Thursday and put my name on the walk-in list. The lady says she will probably have a lane at 10pm. She asks for my number to put down for when a lane is available and I give it to her. Cool. I go to a nearby bar. 10pm comes and goes. Then 10:15. Then 10:30. I arrive at 10:36 having gotten no phone call. A lane is wide open. The lady gives it to me. Me and my date bowl for 15 minutes before the lane breaks down. Apparently a pin is stuck in the tube under the gutter. Fine. Then it happens again two bowls later. A pin is stuck. Next thing I know it has been an hour and we haven't finished a two-person game.   The lady says I don't have to pay. Thanks for not charging me for an hour of my wasted time. I VERY politely ask for an opportunity to be comped next time I come ("pleeasse I really don't mean to be a d*** about this, but I feel my time was not well spent here"). She smiles, shrugs, and says she'll ask her manager. Her "manager" comes over and smiles, shrugs, says she understands why I am frustrated for wasting my time, and the concludes that she doesn't feel comfortable comping me for my wasted time.  Thanks Mission Bowl. Way to treat your customers. You wasted a full 3.5 hours of my time and you don't even offer me an hour worth of free bowling in return. I've heard the word STINGY but I didn't picture your establishment in my brain dictionary under this word until tonight.

-aq0KKWyMbhugu183UGj7Q.review_text: This is a review for the food as we did not bowl here. They take reservations so please reserve online! Please find this review funny.  My 3 companions all got the burger and I got the fried chicken and ordered a side of fries, seeing all the pictures of the pillows of potatoes from fellow yelpers labeled home fries. To my dismay, the fries that came were NORMAL fries :(  The burger was delicious (got a few bites in from my bf) but the fried chicken was okay. I just came back from Houston where I had the best fried chicken at Breakfast Klub and I cant stop thinking about it and I won't shut up about it.  The ranch and aioli sauces were not palatable for me.  My friend really liked the magnolia morning dew beer.  Overall it had a good atmosphere and the food was good an reasonably priced. It wasn't the best I've had, but it was sure worth the visit.

UUaEx34rm3DxygabC6b_sw.review_text: I had a great time there today with a couple friends!   I showed up not knowing what to expect - I was pleasantly surprised. They had a full bar (with very tasty Bloody Mary), a nice brunch menu that goes til 3 on a Sunday, and great food. I had a vegan burger, and it was the perfect (modest) size with a side salad. I ordered an okay house Chardonnay, but I suspect if I'd asked them for a Perfect Manhattan, I would have gotten a great one.  So glad there's a full-service bowling alley in SF!

IcDn5f-a5mt7v3WnFBvOdg.review_text: Pros + bowling, food and drinks all in one place, in the Mission + the environment is very modern and hip + the dining area on the 2nd floor overlooks everything + the crispy fried chicken sandwich special I had was great. Came with perfect fries too. I hope they add it to the menu. + couches to enjoy while bowling, instead of the usual uncomfortable chairs you see at most alleys + the staff, both in the dining area and bowling area, were very friendly  Cons - our bowling lane (#4) was broken! i.e. it wasn't counting multiple pins that we knocked down almost every turn. - prices (mainly for bowling) are rather high - long wait to get a lane - lanes are placed very close to each other, making it hard to bowl in particular styles - the chicken entree: while the chicken itself was good, that's basically all you get besides a tiny sprinkle of greens. It would be nice if there were some less fried/unhealthy options

wTEduhbLx1cEdiaNNwg-zw.review_text: Really great spot! The staff here is really friendly and chill. The food was delicious. If you're here for brunch, I highly recommend the chicken and waffles (more like fried pieces of corn-bread love). The cocktails were great as well. I can see this place getting really busy. I came here for a noon time reservation on a sunday and all lanes were already packed.   I highly recommend this as a date spot!

anScoNPGqurOPRGGqGk7OQ.review_text: First time here and I would come again. I ordered fries and pork chop. It was very tasty.

ESNbiWHJWK9seFiNmw-FDA.review_text: Stopped by for a quick bite last night and it was delicious--the vegan burger was super tasty, with a simple green salad. Just what the doc ordered, with a side of sumptuous red wine! The service was excellent too! Don't stay away just because you aren't bowling--the bar and restaurant stand on their own.

bTFZ-cepM91pdS2PFpvJiA.review_text: Came here for a team event, rented 2 lanes for 2 hours.  LOVED that it was clean, trendy well maintained.. full bar AND good food?  No one could stop talking about how amazing the place was - this is how bowling SHOULD be.  The downside is that they only open up lane reservations 1 week prior, so can be a bit tricky if you are just trying to do an intimate gathering ahead of time.  Fried chicken and burger were both great.  We had to the 2 lanes to the far right so the side counter worked perfectly for us.  Thought the price was also reasonable across the board.  Will definitely return! Hooray for mission bowling club!

Ixd5fdjQreCYpsIkaP_cgQ.review_text: One of the coolest hipster places in San Francisco. Although i probably would never bowl here since its expensive and small - i would def come back for the food.   The Mission burger is the perfect amount salty and savory. Tender meat and savory onions - really really good. Def one of the best burgers I've ever tasted!   Come during hh, its served without fries but its cheaper and less crowded.

T1X6F2bO4JE4cVvfMbYu4g.review_text: You need reservations, but it's worth planning for. Beer/drink selection is really nice, and the atmosphere is chill/fun.

KRfRO8yMi4pCb9Sh8-vGzg.review_text: Tried the Mission burger and the Vegan burger here. The Mission burger is pretty damn good, but maybe a little less mayo would be better, the meat is juicy and tasty enough.   If you're a vegan, you'll love the Vegan burger. IMHO, I'd add some more greens inside the Vegan burger, or maybe a tomato. But the vegan patty is pretty interesting. It does not resemble a traditional veggie patty, it resembles a tofu patty more. This is probably because its made out of chickpeas. Its quite soft inside and lightly fried on the outside with a little spicy kick. Definitely different than most veggie burger patties. So if you're expecting a regular veggie burger, you won't get it. You'll get something else, but it will be pretty good.  Other menu items looked yummy too, I'd be back to try more things. Not sure about bowling there, I hear its expensive. But for dinner, its a great place!

8D2du2DHo1N_XGhXTJHV0A.review_text: Really awesome place in a cool location that needs something like this. This part of the Mission can be a little sketch, but this place is like an oasis.  I went for a birthday dinner and bowling and it really did the trick. First, my burger was excellent. This isn't your standard bar burger. Gormet shit. The Mission Burger isn't cheap at $15, but the caper aioli and Monterey jack cheese really worked well together.  The beer list wasn't extensive but good.  The bowling is tough to get, however. We were munching on dinner for probably 2 hours before we could get a lane. There just aren't a lot of them, so tough to secure a spot.  That said, the staff was helpful and kept us updated with the progress on getting a lane. The lanes were nice, and I always love the scoring that tells you the speed of your roll. It was a nice alley.  I'd definitely go back.

D-rKFBb1s4_4vpDA9Wjiog.review_text: The missionburger is the best burger i've ever had.   Good beers on tap, and bowling is fun.

i0C4bhHjTVaAMKvz6G7fOw.review_text: If you're at MBC and they have a pork special ORDER IT. On the Wednesday before Thanksgiving we popped over for dinner and proceeded to have one of the best meals of our lives. The most tender, juicy, flavorful pork chop with a kumquat marmalade accompanied with brussels and spaetzel. DIVINE! I had to interrupt the chef and pay my compliments. Wow.

HCtEYgABFgwGhHB3rPQeQQ.review_text: First things first. I'm not a big bar food person, but this bar food is too notch!!!! Doesn't get better than this. Tried to go mini golfing at Urban putt but it was a little too crowded so we ended up here. Make sure you put yourself on the list the minute you walk in if you plan to bowl. We didn't because it didn't seem that busy. It was a Wednesday night and we missed our bowling opportunity. : (  Sony our bartender/server is amazing and provided us with the best service ever. She knows every little detail about every drink and menu item. We loved her!

MzXPOK2_T5O8GF-4qUVmGA.review_text: Don't let the name fool you.  You'll not find the standard bowling alley grub fare here.  Oh, no.  The truth is that this menu could not be a bigger departure from standard bowling alley grub fare.  Possibly ever, in the history of bowling.    The fried chicken.  OMG!  This is some of the best fried chicken I've ever had. Serious.  I know...I was surprised too.  The cocktails are artisan to boot.  Gourmet fare w specialty cocktails.  MBC is actually more of a first rate restaurant that happens to have a bowling facility, instead of just a bowling alley that serves food.    Atmosphere is fun.  A great addition to SF.    Who says you have to have generic hot dogs, soggy fries, & greasy onion rings when you want to bowl the night away?    You don't anymore.  Try & sit in a booth.  Somehow sitting in a booth here complimented the whole vibe.  A great dinner & a great time.    4 stars.

gn6XvNDvcrTMF3QbqtCD9Q.review_text: I've been to Mission Bowling club once and had a great time!  The burger was delicious but the drinks were even better.  I wish I could have tried every cocktail on the menu.  They also have a good beer list.  Bowling itself is always fun but I really liked how the cocktail waitresses serve you while you bowl!  No need to go back to the bar yourself, and they were very attentive at keeping our drinks full :)  Can't wait to go back and try the brunch and more bowling!  As for the comments about families, for me it's actually a plus that it's an adult themed bowling ally.  Not everyone wants kids running around while they're having fun with friends..  sorry!

HOnpLdM3-jawK9hxE5TGCg.review_text: A group of friends and I wanted to go bowling for a birthday. I reached out to Mission Bowling Club and even though they were all booked up, they said they had a number of lanes available for walk-ins. We arrived early and were able to secure lanes for the party. The staff helped accommodate our large party and they even set-up my cupcakes with a birthday candle that we brought in. I highly recommend this place to anyone looking for  bowling place with outstanding service.

7H9ewyPrGlr8ybrHC87Egw.review_text: Our rating is an average (rounded-up) for the members of Gentlemen's Burger of the Month Club.  Individual member reviews below:  This one's a down and dirty, greasy burger -- juicy beef, cheese, and tons of aioli.  In other words, totally delicious.  Fries on the side and a beer from MBC's locally themed list makes for a solid dinner. 4.5 out of 5 -Chris P.  This was a pretty messy burger. I ended up eating it with a fork, which is not something I usually like to do. Fortunately, I value taste over tidiness, and this was a tasty burger that was perfectly cooked and full of flavor and delicious toppings. The bun was also excellent, even if it was not quite up to the task of holding all the messy goodness together. 4.5 out of 5 -Jamie H.  At first sight, I was suspicious of my burger. The tomato, lettuce and pickles were on the side and looked like they could have been stolen from McDonald's. I was also worried that my burger might drown in the aioli sauce that looked more like an unhealthy portion of mayo. But looks were deceiving. It only took one bite into the unusually savory meat to change my mind. Best patty I've tasted yet and the aioli complimented it well. Fix the fixings and you might have a 5 star burger. Ps. Bonus points for the fantastic bun. 4 stars for now... -Paul L.  The self-proclaimed 'home of the Mission Burger' indeed had a fantastic bun, but the caper aioli took away from the rest of my burger experience. It was messy, rather nondescript and made the overall burger mushy. Also, for reference, ordering the salad instead of fries is a total error. 3 out of 5 -Cameron E.

25CeUxnELWA4ecRT-D3Ocw.review_text: I have been a Yelper for quite some time but have never written a review. Before I felt as if my opinion didn't matter and I hadn't experienced enough to compare one restaurant's food over another.  That all changed yesterday when my better half made reservations to Mission Bowling Club. I've read reviews and blogs about how hip and trendy this place is (Food, Drink, Atmosphere etc...)  Hell, its a friggin' restaurant with a bowling alley as it's main focus!  Sounds like a winning combination to me. Our experience was so good I had to write a review.  I've had some fantastic burgers in my day... 'Awful Awful' in Reno.  'Burgers and Brew' and the 'Squeeze Inn' in Sacramento.  The super chic 'Umami Burger' in Hollywood.  My hometown favorite 'Andre's' in Lodi.  The California Classic 'In-N-Out'.  All fantastic burgers but The Mission Burger is a religious experience.  I am a fan of a good burger that is fresh, not greasy and has quality meat and toppings.  All previously mentioned burgers are excellent at providing said qualities but never have I had a burger that shows you what the burger should actually taste like.  Every quality of beef that we Americans like are in this burger:  Tender meaty chew from your favorite burger.  The perfect texture of crust and char from an open flame.  The flavor and juices of the best steak you've ever had in your life.... You know what I'm talking about, and they're all in this burger.  The burger itself was so good it completely out-shined the extremely high quality bun and toppings that came with.  I've never had a hamburger that completely nailed the hamburger patty.  Other places choose good quality meat, but then rely on some gimmick or topping to set their burger apart from others.  Not here.  Not at Mission Bowling Club.  I must also note that every other part (except for our host - slow, unfriendly) of our experience was nothing less than fantastic. -Our server was friendly, sweet, and checked on us at the best times, never too much.   -The fried chicken appetizer was insanely good.  Cripsy, tender, very Chicken-y. -We even got a free order of home fries due to a mistake in the kitchen.  BTW better than any other potato dish I've ever had.... And I know my Potatoes!!!   -For dessert we got Cinnamon Crunchy Toast which is everything you love about Cinnamon Toast, Creme Brulee, and Ice Cream.  I've had the single best Hamburger experience and single best Potato experience in my life.

qo9VoTwxz_QdNHAazCKLZQ.review_text: 5 Important Things to Know about Mission Bowling Club:   1. This bowling alley is NOT for kids. This is a bowling alley designed (both aesthetically and menu-wise) for ADULTS. The drinks are intense and tasty and priced for adults who work hard and want to play hard with their friends. The food is designed for a seasoned palate NOT for bowling alley regulars who want deep fried/greasy late night food like nachos or wings. Families you can definitely come once you have all graduated from college and are celebrating your engagement, grad school/med school exams, and parents 30th wedding anniversary but before you and your kids have turned 21 go to Presidio Bowl for neon-family bowling instead.   2. Go as a group with at least 3-4 other friends. You will all pay less that way to rent a lane and to share the tab when you order their tasty drinks. That's just common sense here people...  3. Stop whining about their prices. It's a small bowling alley that can only accommodate 6 lanes of players comfortably (at 2-6 people a team). There's plenty of room to sign up on their reservation list so call ahead and make sure you ask for a lane. It's simple if you plan in advance. If you go later, expect to pay more for late night rates. The drinks are worth the price and are tailored well with great flavor and food pairings.   4. A+ for cleanliness, service, and overall upkeep. Fantastic, intimate ambience, in a really unique space. It's both a nod to the neighborhood but also to the local artists! The art is a variety of styles and levels.   5. Upstairs, downstairs, booth, table, bar, outdoors and indoors seating. You think of it, they found a place for you to sit whether you're there for a drink on a date or with a group to celebrate your birthday they can figure out where to seat you. Outdoor patio with sculpture art YES YES YES!   MISSION BOWLING CLUB IS THE BEST BOWLING ALLEY I HAVE EVER BEEN TO. Period. It's that simple.   And that's coming from someone who has bowled in Chicago, Philadelphia, LA, New York City, and now San Francisco. Yes, I've been to Presidio Bowl and yes, it's fine but it doesn't capture the art, style, and late night/SF noir/leather chairs/bowling alley/sexy escapades vibe that MBC can so well. Cheers Mission Bowling Club, you are kick-ass! I will definitely be back for more.

qNrHLZPurBWJzeAMkFLvvA.review_text: Highlights - Who would have ever guessed this gem of a place existed in this area?  - Bowling alley complete with bar and restaurant all in one. I'm not even hesitating to say YES and tell all my friends about this place, so that I can partake in indulging in their mean burgers and awesome bowling here.  - I like the fact that there aren't a bunch of kids running around here. More of a classy adult day/night out with friends. - Foodwise, think gourmet burger because the burger is around $15, but well worth your $$. Probably the best burger I have tasted.  - Bowlingwise, they have limited lanes and if you have a big group it would be advised to plan ahead and make a reservation. Everything is really new and clean though, which is a plus in my book.   Improvements - Inconvenient location that is not very close to Bart nor do they have much street parking around.   Tip - Park at the lot nearby. It's not too expensive and you won't have to worry about your car.

wHYIzKeTyvqkhXvbut0TQA.review_text: Came here on a Tuesday night for dinner and it was a bit lackluster. I went in and didn't get addressed by the staff at all. A customer having a beer at the counter told me that I needed to get the menus from the bar and gave up his seat for me and moved to the bar. After doing so, I ordered and got the Mission Burger medium. When I got my burger, it was just slightly under well-done with a slight tinge of pink - obviously not medium. I decided to eat it anyway as it didn't bother me that much to want to have them remake it and probably have them throw away this burger in front of me. The burger itself was okay but the bun was rather hard and was rather difficult to bite into. The fries were okay, nothing to write home about. Overall, it was underwhelming and the service, frankly, wasn't very good. I would understand it a bit more if they were very busy but they weren't. Don't see myself coming back unless there was nothing else available unfortunately.

nUms0RzJFJsqlR_VkjrSuw.review_text: I was dressed in my button-up dress shirt and slacks from work, so I had to splash on some hipster-repellent cologne to complete my ironically hip, anti-hipster ensemble for this hipster spot.  So ready to be uncool!  The Tall Vegetarian ordered the $10 Cooler, served in a tall pint glass, and my manly self ordered the $10 Honey Bee, served in a dainty martini glass.  How ironic to start the evening.  For the night, between the Cooler, Honey Bee, and TBD, I preferred the Honey Bee because I'm ironically sweet like that.  The food lacked irony - just bluntly delicious or not:  - $7 Sausage Corn Dog & $8 Fried Chicken - The Corn Dog is just a sausage, breaded and fried.  The Chicken was a little too crispy with a little too much breading, although the meat was moist.  Gimme two bacon-wrapped hot dogs from the carts outside instead.  - $15 Mission Burger - A bit salty, but nevertheless tasty with the crispy fries.  (The Tall Vegetarian's $10 Vegan Burger looked good, too, but I didn't have a taste for fear of Tall Vegetarian cooties.  I heard you become a vegetarian, if you're infected.)  - $11 Crispy Pork Belly & $19 Marrow Braised Short Ribs - Small bites of both were amazing.  Pricey for the size, but I should have gotten these instead of the burger.  - $7 Cinnamon Toast Crunch & $8 S'mored Brownie - Get both, and then post a pic about ironically getting the best desserts at a bowling alley with the #YOLO hashtag.  The bowling is definitely posh - newer shoes, fancy scoring, and big comfy couch seating rather than plastic chairs.  But then again, I would have much preferred the ironic hipness of cheap folding chairs instead.  Wait, now I'm just confusing myself.  Maybe it's be hip to be confused?

wBGcrVreF1QAkTgHXVO3Hg.review_text: It turns out I'm a pretty good bowler (maybe the drinks helped).  I've been here twice to drink and enjoy the outside patio and once bowling. I haven't tried the food here, but I hear it's pretty damn tasty. They have decent beers on tap, and the bartenders aren't shy to make recommendations. As with all the new places popping up in the mission, MBC is pretty hipster trendy. But the staff is nice  No food allowed in the bowling area, which kinda sucks. but I understand that they want to prevent grease from getting all up on their balls

NDw3ViA756mSTMV2HQeobQ.review_text: The bowling and drinks are great, but the food and service need much better execution. The venue is really cool with a hipster vibe in the most positive sense. it won't take much to improve both food and service. Management just needs to pay more attention.

_aSs5dSAabuwnXUGBPzASw.review_text: Date & Time:  Monday March 19, 2012 @ 7pm Companion:  The Husband Scene:  Hipsters in Flannel Checkered Shirts+Skinny Jeans & Girls in Short Striped Dresses w/ Hue Tights Music:  Rock & Alternative Decor:  Warehouse turned Bowling Alley + Resto.  Cool Bar, Dining Rooms in Main Level & Loft, 6 Bowling Lanes Service:  Very Friendly Imbibe:  Gin Fizz & Beer Devour:  Thai Beef Jerky, Everything Pretzel, Corn Dog, Burger, Coffee Cake, Panna Cotta Total:  $68.36

VSINPig75DiGswnie1xxYA.review_text: Ate here last night and enjoyed all our food choices. The only negative is that portions are very tiny for the price.    We had the roasted carrots, the melon salad (the white melon portion was great), and the vegan burger (it seems you get a half a burger portion).  Even the meat eating hubby liked the burger a lot.  We like the chef and his ideas and dishes.  Not sure if we liked it enough to go back just to eat.  We walked over to bi rite after for salted caramel ice cream. And then onto The Marsh for Boomeraging , from LSD to OMG by Will Durst (eh, a little repetitive)

-34NV3A5a5gcL-s8UH4KbA.review_text: 1) The space is pretty cool. 2) The staff are awesome and supportive of parties and large groups 3) The food is DELICIOUS. Like really really good. 4) Drinks are also DELICIOUS.  That's all. That's all you need to know.

dB11NQfvGM-cv-05YV_SGQ.review_text: One thing I like to do, but don't get to do much is bowling.  I usually go bowling once every 5 years or so.  If I'm lucky, I'll break 30.  Gutter balls love me.  After this morning, I do have a new found liking for the Mission Bowling Club.  A good friend of mine suggested meeting up for brunch and bowing there.  Rad!   Mission Bowling Club is a triple threat!  You have the restaurant portion, the bar and a small bowling alley.  You don't have to feel inclined to eat, drink and bowl but you're certainly welcome to do as many or little or the activities you fancy.      Our party of four started off with brunch (with reservation) at 11am.  Meanwhile, we were also waiting for a lane to open up.  Luckily, friend got there a little early and was able to sign up for a walk-in lane.  Otherwise, you need to call and reserve a lane more than a week in advance.  The waitress was great server and didn't get annoyed with our special requests.  Bf and I asked to substitute the sides of potatoes with salads and also had the sauces on the side.  Only gripe I had was that it took incredibly long for us to get our food (about 30 minutes) and there were only a few other tables of patrons.     Brunch eats: - Crab Benedict: In hindsight, I should have ordered this instead of nibbled off of bf's plate.  The crab and over easy eggs were wonderful on the English muffins.  The Hollandaise sauce had just the right amount of lemony flavor.  Side salad was dressed with a light vinaigrette.   - Mission Burger:  I hadn't had a burger since I can't even remember when.  If friend didn't mention the burger, I wouldn't have known about it since it wasn't on the brunch menu.  Apparently, they serve it all day.  The burger was huge....we guessed about 1/2 beef patty.  The burger was stacked pretty high and came with caramelized onions, swiss cheese, tomatoes, lettuce, pickles and aioli.  I also asked for the side salad.  I'm not sure why they cut off the tops of the buns but that's fine with me.  Although the beef patty was juicy and well seasoned, it was a bit salty for my taste.      - Waffles:  Friend ordered the waffles minus the chicken.  They served two perfectly golden brown, crispy waffles with butter and syrup.  I tried a small piece and it was quite yummy.  - Hibiscus Ice Tea:  I was very happy that they didn't put sugar in the hibiscus tea.  It was tangy and refreshing.   Overall, the meal was good.  It's much better than any fast/bar food served at most bowling establishments.  Our tab pre-tax (including 2 cocktails and another burger) was $86.    Bowling:  We paid for 1 hour which included shoe rentals for the 4 of us.  It cost $35.  There are 6 lanes and plenty of bowling balls to go around.  They have comfy leather couches for everyone to sit on.  All the while bowling, you can stop by the bar for a drink and also order food.  The bowling staff was super friendly.  Shoes were a little nasty but I didn't get any feet fungus so I'm peachy.  Children are allowed to bowl until 6pm.    Parking is tough in the Mission but don't let that stop you from giving Mission Bowling Club a try!  Food is better than alright.  Bar seemed laid back.  Bowling = fun factor!

Z-NjDpNw_SDPEap81FN9OQ.review_text: This joint will be opening at 6pm tonight!   This will be the second bowling alley opening in SF in just two weeks! Glad there are more choices to choose from once Serra Bowl closes it's doors.   This bowling alley has 6 lanes, where 3 are reserved for walk-in's (unlike lucky strike). They also serve food here. Check out the menu uploaded! There's food on a stick!   There are also tables in the front patio to hang out and grub if you choose not to bowl.

Al91UkRtVxCXnT4-lTpa7w.review_text: I never venture to the Mission, but I'd totally come back here. We didn't bowl, just came for drinks and food for a friend's birthday. The food was beyond great. I never expected restaurant quality food here, but it could give a lot of places in the city a run for their money. The drinks are also spectacular. There were so many of us, we would go up to the bar in waves, so we kept them pretty busy. Towards the end of the night we were hanging out by the end of the bar and the bartender joked asking what kind of shot we were having, but we were pretty done for the night. He brought out 7 shot glasses and lined them up and we were confused. He saw our faces and just said "what? they're just shot glasses." He poured out seven shots of whisky and said it was on the house . . . turns out he was one of the owners. Awesome food, awesome drinks, AWESOME owners!

aHkN15XSGeDqkM85voZG3Q.review_text: Given how much I like Mission Chinese Food, I had really high expectations for the food here, but it was disappointing in both taste and portion size.  The blackened salmon was too salty and somewhat burnt tasting, the beet salad was flavorless and unimpressive and the "latka" was just a mushy hash brown.  I went with a party of 6 and no one was really that happy with the food.  Especially considering how much our meal cost, we shouldn't have had to go to El Farolito afterwards to feel full and satisfied, but we did.     The best thing that I had all night was my drink.  I had the TBD (mescal, dry vermouth, jalapeno jam and lime), which was delicious and expertly made.   MBC is a cool spot with great ambiance, but I would only come back here to bowl and drink.  The service was mediocre (we felt unwelcome and rushed even there were other empty tables) and the food was expensive and unsatisfying in every way.  If you do come here to bowl though, make a reservation because there are only 6 lanes.

aRflSjWTqdI7ZmH_QaApZA.review_text: Ohhhh Mission Bowling Club, where do I start?  When we first met, I stepped in your doors for a first date with a fellow from OKCupid.  I admitted it.  What?  I'm putting myself out there.  The burger was juicy and flavorful.  The drink selections were plentiful.  There was, however, no bowling.  That is a whole other animal.  An animal that I know nothing about at this establishment, since it seems impossible to ever see a free lane.  I have since given up on that pipe dream.
