I have seen you once again, now that I live around the corner.  I brought a fresh SF transplant here to share with her your charms.  She mentioned possibly having her upcoming birthday party there.  "This weekend?  It's Wednesday now.  Fat chance."  And with that, her dreams were crushed.  Okay, maybe not, but seriously?!  I wonder if there will ever be a day that I can enter this spot and be able to bowl without having a reservation weeks in advance.  I realize there are only three lanes, but come onnnnnnnnn!    One can dream.

uGGjLd5JCVIfmfXSXABqpQ.review_text: PLEASE READ BEFORE COMING!!!  If you want to go to a place where you are treated kindly with respect and want to have an experience of a lifetime DON'T COME HERE!!!! In a nut shell.... If you are anything but WHITE, OLD, and HIPSTER looking guaranteed you will be treated unfairly. (Nothing against White ppl, Old ppl, or Hipsters)  Let me explain our sad experience at this hell hole....  Saturday Night 9/28/13: My friend was throwing a b-day dinner for his gf. SMALL group of 8 ppl. Upon arrival, staff still made the party wait for 20 MINUTES PLUS. Ummm reservations made for NOTHING apparently...while others (WHITE PPL, get to walk in and be seated with no problem no matter how big their group). STRIKE ONE.   When my friend's bf asked to speak with manager, the coward fill in mgr, who was a Caucasian female with short black hair, refused to talk to our group, WHAT???? STRIKE TWO!!!   When finally seated, two ppl of the party (myself and hubby) arrived half and hr late and waitress was asked to add us to the table. No big deal we thought as there were plently of empty tables available. However, per mgr, we could not add a table to the group because it was a "Fire Hazard" and "Those extra tables were for other walk-in guests" STRIKE THREE!!! Anyplace else, would of been no problem.   Service: awful. Especially if you are upstairs. Waiters are lazy (esp you blondie), and they will minimize the times they need to assist you to avoid the long trip up and down the stairs. STRIKE FOUR!!!  Yes, the food was good thanks to experienced culinary Mexicans in the kitchen, muchas gracias!!!   We bowled and that was OK as we had music (big whoop same at many other bigger bowling alleys, Lucky Strike, Seabowl, etc). What was not fun was that there were no waitresses to bring drinks. You would have to go to the bar to bring drinks back which is inconvenient if you are trying to buy rounds and bowling on a timed schedule. It sucked to have to wait for ppl to come back from the bar which at times took awhile and interfered with the game. STRIKE FIVE!!!!  As we were leaving to a BETTER LOCATION, there was a good song playing and my friend and I, who were far from being drunk, started singing to a song as we walked out. As we did, we were attacked by the door man who yelled at us to stop singing because they did not want the neighbors to complain. He literally tried to scold us as if we were children in front of other guests who were looking at him like what the heck is his deal???......at that point I had had enough of this dump and vowed to never come back. STRIKE SIX.!!!  Despite all the wonderful reviews ppl have left for this place....sadly not everyone here is treated the same. Our small group was a mixture of SF Locals, Military Veterans, Teachers, and Out of Town Guests. Luckily we went to 16th and Valencia St. after and had a blast which made us kind of forget the unfortunate experience at Mission Bowl which should be renamed "WE WILL TREAT YOU LIKE DIRT BOWL."

9MZegxijKS1t5aiwgW2D0w.review_text: Food is tremendous; it started out great but a little oily, but over multiple trips it continued to improve. The burger is one of the best I've had. btw - the burger to-go is just as good as eating it there. Bowling is so fun, hilarious and if you're not a jerk, they're very kind about giving you a little extra few minutes if they can. At the same time they're good about getting you your lane on time and not leaving people who've had their time on for extra time. Drinks are really good.  It always comes down to the people for me, and as in every place I love, the people here are totally awesome.

qMF9AxnVt6JGFtlLY7m88g.review_text: Tried to make a reservation for 14  at a restaurant may be one of the most difficult things you can do in San Francisco. I was frantically trying to find a place to have my 21st birthday party and stumbled on Mission Bowling Club.  They were able to accommodate everyone for lanes, including a table reservation upstairs for dinner after. The service was very nice and friendly, and when they took a little while longer than expected to get our tables ready, they threw in an extra game of bowling for us!  In the end, it was a successful 21st birthday. Drunk bowling and good food with great friends is afterall all one can really ask for a successful night out!

AlgwaveLYUhPX327TDO3rg.review_text: For 23 long years of life, I have hated bowling -- until I went to Mission Bowling last night. When you have a clean, hip, fun environment, plus excellent food (highly recommend the fried chicken and chili cheese fries), real-deal cocktails, good service, not overpriced, not too packed, indoor-outdoor patio, comfy and not terrible looking bowling shoes (plus cute socks available for only $4 if you forgot your own) -- how can you go wrong? This place is perfect for birthdays, dates, you name it. I can't wait to go back.

gSqxSw8CvnKpxjzNyuCkYw.review_text: Worst. Bartender. Ever.   If you want a drink that tastes like something you made in middle school when you broke into your parents' liquor cabinet, then you'll like this place.   Honestly, it doesn't matter which drink you order, because it won't taste like what you ordered. I ordered a dark and stormy that tasted and looked like a long island iced tea (but a bad long island iced tea).   And the bar tender was so S-L-O-W. Partly because he was more interested in socializing than doing his job, and partly because he's clearly just an awful bartender. No wonder he was working on a Monday night (last night).   Bowling was fine, not great--but what you'd expect from a hipster hangout in the City.

HrKZHln-qA3z0LOhqWUCeQ.review_text: A great place to bowl with even better employees!  I met my Girlfriend a year ago at this place and recently went back to celebrate our 1 year anniversary. I forgot to make a reservation, but Fred and Joe were able to fit me and my woman in for a quick bowling session, but were so excited that we came back to the place we met.   Great service and a great atmosphere!   Thanks guys, you made the night.

LqK9jxnp-X61q742Y5F_Vw.review_text: What a great place. I celebrate my 25th birthday at this place and everyone had a wonderful time. Service was nice, food was good and yummy drinks. We will come back :D

U9yWtQO_0LPjtaU9jN0JsA.review_text: Came here for a meeting so can't comment on the bowling. We ordered several appetizers - the normal bar food - nothing memorable. I couldn't leave without trying the fried chicken which came in several chicken pieces on a long stick with dipping sauce. The famed fried chicken was only okay. I think it was too heavily breaded. Maybe because they're boneless pieces but as soon as I bit into one the skin just fell off the rest of it so I was eating pieces of chicken meat alongside pieces of breaded chicken skin. Not the most pleasant way to eat fried chicken.

qEdxnnadZ2tcU9JOXjnGdw.review_text: #223.  Great place for groups to hang out.  Be warned though, this place is small: only eight lanes.  And if you come here on a day where two lanes are out of order, this place only gets smaller.    With 25% of the bowling alley gone and the rest fully booked, we had to wait 45 minutes before a lane was available.  Reserve ahead of time!  You can put your name on the waiting list, but there's no guarantee.  You have to wait until someone cancels in order to get a spot.   The place is nice though.  There's a patio and lounge adjacent to the bowling alley, so there is decent food and drink if you're hungry.  There were five people in my party, and we were able to play a full game and then some.  I think rental is around $60 for an hour and shoes were $3 or so.  Definitely good for groups.  __________ My 2¢: - This place is small.  Reserve a lane before your group arrives.

stQ0nzs7x4n8Kde_CN3F0Q.review_text: A fun bar with a Bowling Alley attached - I say that because it is REALLY hard to secure a lane! If you ever want to do an impromptu bowling night, this is probably not the place for you - usually a long wait for a lane, but if you are OK with that, the bar and restaurant here makes for a great waiting room!  Food is tasty and the drinks and pitchers are well priced.  Also, when you do get on a lane, it makes for a fun night with a great vibe.

k2xdkJHb44nXpvbZVDEzrA.review_text: Bowling: SO fun and nostalgic. A bit pricey and they only allow 3 lanes to be reserved so it's recommended you do it early. Otherwise its first come first serve. THey made that seem scary to me and like i HAD to make a reservation, but really there "first come first serve" lanes when I went on a Sat morning were totally free the whole 2 hours I bowled.   Food: AMAZE-BALLS! Seriously...so good! Had their breakfast sandwich (went on a Sat morning) and it was mouth watering. Friends got the chicken and waffles which were also amazing. Wow.   Will definitely be back.

eIa4QJXp5ZNmuFORnuPvDA.review_text: Been dying to go here for so long - good for a casual and fun dinner! On the music: loved the mix. I remember hearing Little Dragon, Kanye, Solange, and lots of good 90s rock. The service was laid back and friendly. They were sure to check in with us often. Cost: $26 per person total (including tax & tip). We got 2 drinks, 1 app, and 1 entree - a good dinner for two. ~~Cocktails~~ * Honey Bee - 4 stars (tito's vodka, honey syrup, fresh lemon, orange flower water. $10) Slightly bitter from the vodka, but the server did say this one had a slightly stronger taste from the alcohol base. It was still refreshing, kind of tart the way I like my cocktails, and lemony. A good drink. ~~Apps~~ * Fried chicken - 4.5 stars pic: yelp.com/biz_photos/miss… (w/ ranch dip, cayenne + paprika breading. $8) What a great value! You get three giant pieces, and they all have super moist and tender meat. The breading was nice and crunchy, and the dip thick and delicious. I love low they hoist up the pieces on a stick over a wooden board so you can see the oil drip off. There is also a layer of some sauce between the breading and the meat that was spicy! We thought it was sriracha but it was their own seasoning mix. ~~Entrees~~ * Flemish Ale roast pork - 3.5 stars pic: yelp.com/biz_photos/miss… (and spring vegetables. pork belly, favas, orach, cherries, chard leg. $18) The pork was moist, though the meat was a little tough with very thick layers of fat. I prefer pork belly to be softer with a bit of a crisp, while this was more homogeneous meat. The fava beans were nice and the cherries not too sweet. The chard leg was basically pieces of crispy fried skin (nice). But the veggies were like collard greens, kind of flat and flavorless.

2OYuOS2LUEZpMJw6ur_9pQ.review_text: For the dining side: Rarely do I spend more than $10 on a burger, even in an expensive city. Rarely should ANYONE spend more than $10 on a burger; if you're spending that kind of money there needs to be a party going on in your mouth, unlike the snoozefest you get (or rather I personally get lol) with Mel's $10+ Avocado burger that tasted and felt like a typical $3-$4 burger.   Mission's burger is $15. I was starving and didn't want to trust anything else random on that menu like the "Seared Halibut" or  "Summer Ratatouille" (really is this an American bowling alley or a fine dining restaurant?? LMAO), so I got the burger. I heard from others it's usually salty but mines didn't taste that salty. Of course again I was starving so maybe I overlooked it haha but overall was a very good burger. Except for that cabbage stuff or whatever that is that comes on it. I'm glad it automatically came with fries because at $15 if it didn't I would've probably yelled at the manager. Stop trying to act like your restaurant is some grand location with a beach view and orchestra. One thing I don't get is how the Vegan burger is cheaper than the meat burger isn't that backwards??   We had a rather large party because it was someone's birthday celebration. The waitress who seemed rather annoyed was trying to be nice but wasn't doing a very good job. Big tables are big tables. DEAL WITH IT.   For the bowling side: Um that is a very small alley; only 6 lanes?? Not worth the wait on a busy night (we went last Saturday). At least the glow in the dark pins are cool to look at. If going to bowl, be dressed for the occasion please! Apparently a memo went around that you had to be semi-formal because like all the guys had on button-ups and all the ladies were pretty much dolled up like at a mixer. You most likely won't find any baggy jeans, fitted caps, over-revealing skirts/short and tight dresses or sweatshirts at this place (except for me, I think I was the only one wearing a sweatshirt. In my defense, it was a zip-up one) lol.

BZ76C50h--GlEMZxY9kEgg.review_text: To an East Bay Suburbanite - taking BART to get to this place for a friend's Birthday was super easy! Tucked between poorly lit buildings, the Mission Bowling Club is inviting with its outdoor seating and bright lights!    The bar has some great house cocktails on the menu - the HoneyBee was delicious.  Dinner was interesting...I'm a 5 year old at heart when it comes to eating, so the menu put me right at the edge of my comfort level.  The hubs and I split a burger and their version of a caprese salad that came with "edible dirt"  It was worth checking out but I'll hold the dirt next time.   Bowling was great - we had two lanes for the rest of the night and had a blast celebrating the Birthday Girl!  The Bartenders were keeping us "hydrated" and the staff was super chill and friendly.  Great spot, loads of fun!

cVHGXQFo2roQGH0wvZeWHA.review_text: For me, I believe I found the best burger in SF.   Well, this is pending a visit to Blue Stem and NOPA. Plus Roam Burger is a current co-champion with MBC, but its just in a different class.  The burger was big, the patty was thick and full of medium rare goodness, and each bite was just an explosion of flavor. The fries were pretty good too, but then again, I like french fries in general. Since we generally enjoy more portions, I give the nod to this over Marlowe or the Cavalier based on burger size.  The place however oozes with trendy hipster-ness. I've already over paid for bowling at Lucky Strike, so I'll pass on playing here. However, it is a good place to people watch when your table is on the second floor. In the two visits I have made here, it does make for a lively and entertaining atmosphere. The facility and dining areas are clean, and the wait staff are competent here.   Overall, I do like the spin this place puts on your standard bowling alley. You can wait for a table at their reasonably spacious bar area, with a few craft beers available on draft. Otherwise, get a reservation online if the time permits.

crxhOesQjRjlPr9tuqralA.review_text: The service here is appalling. Four people behind the bar, three people waiting, and no orders taken. For 15 minutes.

If_EHwN-G2HOkCTIWNhSfQ.review_text: I am a newly converted huge fan of this place! Decided to spend a Sunday afternoon in the Mission and got brunch at Mission Bowling.  The pork belly hash was incredible: the pork belly was so tender but with crispy skin, on top of sweet potatoes and mustard greens.  The fried chicken, however, was my favorite part of the meal.  It was so crispy, perfect spice and came with a great cream dipping sauce.  It has ruined all other chicken places for me.    The space is pretty special. A loft dining area, table out on the patio, bar, and don't forget tables and couches for when you are bowling.  Yeah, its hipster, but in the best way possible.  On top of the meal, bowling was great.  A bit pricey, but I didn't go all the way to mission for just any bowling alley.  Unfortunately, our lane had some mechanical malfunction, eating into our allotted time.  No worries, they set us up with a new lane and gave us an extra hour for our trouble! We bowled so much, my arm couldn't take another game even if I wanted to.  To summarize: great food, great service, great venue, no complaints.

_Kt01zAkzGDjSphy7W3qOA.review_text: This place is tres San Francisco. It takes a very Americana concept and repurposes it to match our collective snooty, refined taste. Case and point: expensive, fancy drinks. Killer potato appetizers instead of fries. Homemade vegan burgers made of chickpeas and kale. Only 5 or so lanes to bowl with in the first place - which creates scarcity and therefore desire.  The Dude might not abide, but I sure do. I definitely think this place wins Achiever status.

8P50te5SxbNJanOkc6iesg.review_text: We held a birthday party for a good friend of mine at Mission Bowling Club on a Saturday night. Bowling was fun, cocktails were great, manager was accommodating. Most everybody was very friendly and we had a great time.  However, one of the bartenders, a short and thin woman with straight short hair was not only a bad bartender, but she was mean.  After bowling, my friends and I went over to the bar to continue celebrating.  We sat at the bar for more than 20 minutes before the bartender acknowledged us or asked us what we would like (and the bar wasn't busy).  All we wanted were a few glasses for a craft of water that I had received earlier in the night. After waiting so long for water glasses, and not receiving them, I decided to drink straight from the craft (a small bottle).  This got the bartender's attention and she finally brought us water glasses.  Then, my friend offered to buy me a cocktail and the bartender refused to serve me because I had drank from the craft.  She said it was an indication that I was drunk when in all actuality, it was a clear indication that the bartender was not attentive and took more than 20 minutes to get us water glasses.  My friends and I got a kick out of this because I had only had two drinks all night and was clearly not drunk.  I apologized for drinking out of the craft but she continued to refuse to serve me a cocktail. I was unable to participate in the toast for my good friends birthday.  I was being very nice to the bartender and trying to make light of the situation but she was clearly taking something else out on me. This was unprofessional, mean and represents Mission Bowling Club poorly.  This is too bad because besides the weak-link of a bartender, we had a great time.

h1vVClifElhxCb-a7TChIA.review_text: Things that make you go hmmm...  Theres burgers over there them bowling...  I thought I smelled a burger, I did I did...beef beef...  7/10 beef, nice buns, dressings...  Interesting dining area.

_7nUM6OzjcpWxuZ20nodFQ.review_text: I'm really not always super excited to go bowling, but my girlfriends planned a Saturday afternoon for us all to hang out at the Mission Bowling Club. (I was thinking, "really... can't we find something more exciting?")  Well, I was pleasantly surprised by this place and is definitely the best atmosphere and hip bowling alley I had ever visited. The food and drinks are just as amazing, too. It made for a really fun afternoon with friends! Next time I go bowling, I'll be back here.

tv1MpIa4AkUhZkxH-19oDA.review_text: Wonderful venue for a small corporate event!  We hosted our annual holiday party at Mission Bowl this year and I cannot say enough about the wonderful experience.  The staff was SO helpful in putting together a simple event in which everyone had fun, we had great food, and plenty of drinks to keep the fun going.  Jillian, the event planner walked me through all of our options and helped me to select the perfect menu for our group that worked within our slightly humble budget.    A couple hours of bowling later and everyone was thanking me for choosing this as our holiday party this year.  Thank you Mission Bowling Club! You made us all MERRY and BRIGHT :)

r-A0VKZVWhVPwcwfybbAMg.review_text: I was a little skeptical going in but I had a great time. Despite relatively few lanes, the wait was not very long. Staff was very friendly and accommodating. Nice bar, (from what I hear) good food, and a cool space.   Also, they played Pony by Ginuwine. Would definitely come back again.

_E8fCCrB9T4wZnX8CsS75A.review_text: 1/2lb burger with fries is so worth it for $15! it is a large portion and has ALL the dressings. I can never finish the burger so I always have it for leftovers and it's still good  The lanes are usually always crowded so you would have to be there at the right time to get a lane, but you can definitely book a reservation

v4iP3AChmQ8Rls9UTPmThA.review_text: Why you would make a bowling alley with just 8 lanes beats me. Overall the place was clean and swanky with a good vibe and the bowling staff was nice.    Bowling: We had a fun time bowling with friends, but the lanes are def not regulation. Really short runway before the lane starts, and the lanes are narrower than usual. I bowled a 109 and 120 - my husband didn't break 100 and complained all night about the non-regulation lanes. Spare me!  Food: They make you eat far away from where you bowl so it's not really conducive to eating and having fun with friends while bowling, which is weird cuz I thought that was whole the point. Took the bar tender 20 minutes to take our order. The Deviled eggs and French fries were not particularly good.

fxyXOkSrkQ2xF51d_LrSIQ.review_text: My favorite bowling alley in San Francisco, well maybe just my favorite place in San Francisco, basically the best place to spend time if you are looking for a) something to do b) something to eat c)something to drink. All three areas are exceptional, from a fun staff to exceptional food and even better cocktails/beers to 6 lanes that don't feel like your average bowling alley. The team at MBC also take being a part of the community very seriously, working with non-profits and youth groups nearby (7 teepees etc) to really make a difference.   Cannot recommend this place more highly!!!

LTWUnGE5dCVGFsKuwuWV9A.review_text: Drinks/dinner/bowling here is a fun, though a bit pricey, way to spend an evening.   We arrived early and started with the cocktails at the bar. I know, I know, I'm a snobbish San Franciscan whose bare minimum for acceptability is a good cocktail. These were good cocktails, and were worth the $10 or whatever the price was, but they were just good. I wasn't blown away, but I thought they were solid. I had a very nice mezcal/lime cocktail which is a spinoff of a margarita.   Then dinner. This is where I actually think they shined. My friend had said the food was kind of mediocre, but I was pleasantly surprised.  The seasonal salad was a gaspacho-infused melon salad which was very light and summery.  I had the chicken roulade, which was super flavorful and came with brussels sprouts.  The total for both was $29, which is well within the realm of acceptability. The zinfandel they had on tap was great as well.   Bowling was fun, but pricey. I think for 6 people at prime time with lane rental and shoe rental we paid $80. But we had a great time, and the computerized system was much more advanced then those I've seen elsewhere.   Overall, a lot of fun. Will definitely go back.

Xj0O2l0bp633ebmG468aZw.review_text: Came here for food. They had a wait but were flex and let us sit upstairs. The menu was tantalizing. The pork tenderloin was a scanty portion. And totally overpriced.

mDTrcaA-0SvxG4AYmgMCMA.review_text: This is a fun spot for bowling, which I do about once a year so I don't take it too seriously. I've been here twice for birthdays and both times the large groups enjoyed their experiences. Reservations were made in advance to reserve mulitple lanes. Since you can squeeze 6 people per lane the price per person isn't bad (avg $45/hr/lane).   I definitely preferred coming on Sunday afternoon since I liked the brunch options better. If you like all the elevated comfort food, you'll like the fried chicken and cornmeal waffles, loco moco, chilaquiles, biscuits and gravy. Portions were fair for about $10. I would go back just for brunch without the bowling since there is plenty of seating in the dining area, at the bar, and outside. For dinner, the greasy foods are on the apps side and you get the usual California cuisine entree options for $15+, which is difficult to eat at that side shelf thing when you're trying to bowl. Drinks were also good and standard pricing for a non-dive bar in the Mission.  You can order food and drinks at the bar on your own, separate from the bowling tab, so there's no messy tabs to split among your party. Staff was nice and not pretentious. But when one of the birthday boys was starting to show signs of drunkenness, we were politely asked to leave.

j2apIyDIcVyHxxSFoaCiLg.review_text: I love this place! I had no idea that this place existed until we were invited here for a birthday meetup. I must have passed by it dozens of times before.  This is not your normal bowling alley and while it might be comparable to the brand new Lucky Strike, I am assuming that Mission Bowling Club has a lot less douche bags. Its more a hipster place than anything. (Think: guys wearing skinny jeans, thick rimmed glasses, hair swept to the side, drinking PBR). But hey, who doesn't love a hipster?  I digress- this place is awesome. The decor is really nice, the bar is beautiful. Hand crafted cocktails and an impressive food menu. The staff is nice as well. You won't find fake nacho cheese here. I can definitely see this place being a great place to rent out for a cocktail party. They have a beautiful upstairs and outside space as well.  If you're in the area, this place is definitely worth checking out. My only complaint is that it closes at midnight...hope that changes!!!

pILIpZRwQdQF1Rcm8r2RDg.review_text: Quick update - went in for dinner last night and they have updated the menu with a variety of options.  The selection has been greatly expanded with familiar favorites but with a fresh, local flair.  Great change and the food was delicious! And, as always, the best crew in the City to serve these great dishes.

qSh-q8M-rL4PRVukXsDwWg.review_text: Super trendy and cute bowling venue for groups to hangout, eat, and play in the city. Mission Bowling Club offers an intimate and classy ambiance for bowling. This is not your average bowling club so it's expected that it's a bit pricer than the other bowling venues in the area.  They have a full service kitchen that serves food and drinks. The staff is friendly. It's really a ideal choice for the yuppie, older crowds who are looking for a great group spot or date night spot.

L3fXp2Bn4ONh7kV5oDOIZA.review_text: I'll admit we came here just to see it with the hopes of scoring a lane.   No luck on the lane, but we were pleased with the friendly service. The hostess is the nicest ever and the bowling managers were so friendly.   They excellent beers on tap (we so wished we would have been there a week later so we could taste Pliny the Younger!) and we had fun watching the olympics on the large screen.   Hopefully next time we go we can check out the food! It's a fun atmosphere even if you aren't bowling and definitely the fanciest bowling alley we have ever been to.

OZ1NmK2RLv0UxGFABE0CHw.review_text: My review is based solely on the burger, because that's all I got. Stopped in on Friday afternoon with a bunch of people as part of a little Happy Hour food crawl. Because we were going to be eating a lot, three of us shared the burger. After the first bite, I knew that I wanted to eat it all! It was juicy, it was well-seasoned, it had great texture, and the combo of meat and cheese and caramelized onions was spot on. Everything worked!  Get the burger!

ru56jxMOThHWLccvXLPXdQ.review_text: This was one of the best birthday parties I have been too. Never mind, that I was the genius mastermind behind the idea to have a party at a hip place such as this. Thankfully it was Pride and no one wanted to bowl on such a glorious Sunday afternoon because we had a nice choice of times to bowl.  There are only 6 lanes and you can only reserve one 7 days in advance. So, I think you have to be pretty zealous to get a lane in general.  The price is between $35-45 for one hour of bowling. The shoes cost extra and remember to bring your own socks because their only option are a crappy pair for 5 bucks. Obviously, somebody by the name of Natasha forgot her socks.  My bowling score was 104- which made me so happy because I usually bowl about a 30.  Those damn gutters are always in the way.  The bartender made me a glorious Bloody Mary to accompany my two previous Royal Bermuda Yacht Club Cocktails- a cocktail that tastes similar to the kind of drink that causes a lot of teenage pregnancies.  All the staff was unbelievably friendly and special kudos to the young kid that works the actual bowl desk. That kid is awesome and definitely knows how to do the service thing right.

BbBzub67X5sAHHTEtk2GAA.review_text: I came here for a holiday event so I'm not too sure about what the prices are but after looking at the menu online it looks to be decently priced for the portions + quality of their food!  Coming to a place called "Mission Bowling Club," I really didn't expect there to be food..  However, this was PROBABLY THE BEST BURGER I'VE EVER HAD (Gamine is a close second!) Doesn't need any ketchup or extra sauce because it's so damn flavorful and juicy. I can give this place 5 stars just for the damn burger.  Drinks are good and strong, and the fried chicken appetizer was also pretty freakin' amazing.  Bowling is fun and service is attentive. Clean and spacey. That goes for the bathroom as well. Lol =)  MM.. I can't wait to come here again...

UsXqCXRZwSCSw0AT7y1uBg.review_text: How out of shape does one have to be in order to get a giant muscle knot in their butt cheek after a game and a half of bowling?   Because that is precisely how out of shape I am.  Basically could not walk today. Totally not a joke. Totally worth having a pimp limp today for all the fun had wiping the floor with my co-workers during a friendly game of bowling.   Our group of 14 took over 3 lanes, had a small buffet of hand-held bites that kept-a-coming, and access to any of the bar's hand-crafted cocktails, craft beer, and wine. The only caveat on these things was that you couldn't bring the food over to the couch/lane area, so you basically had to stand and eat, but it was a good way to keep the area clear and clean so us bowling aficionados could have our space to do our rituals and bowls our strikes, spares, and sadly sometimes gutter balls.   I was surprised to see there were only 6 lanes in this bowling club, so it's not ideal for huge groups or coming in without a reservation, but they have a great bar, dining, and patio area if you're in it for just the food and drinks, which as far as bowling alley beverages and bites go- were spectacular, even including some vegan options (burgers- which were outstanding).  Besides all the winning I did, my favorite thing about coming here was that they've got great balls. A lot of bowling alleys carry mainly big balls that are in the 10-15lb range, and that's just too big for me. I need something more in the 7-10 range and they had quite a few balls that catered to my lack of upper body strength, just out and available so I didn't have to ask for a kids ball or anything.    I only wish I had more friends to bowl with... and that they allowed more character/spaces when entering your name on the score board so I coulda been 'BigErn'. 5 letters is too few letters, MBC.

c4bNOJ5XnKKoHJoQE4zrcQ.review_text: Fun, relaxing atmosphere with good food. Lanes are hard to get and EXPENSIVE. You pay by the hour and they cut you off to the second :(

uXisHyFcwaeAvZDTwWjsKg.review_text: We went there on a team offsite and I was surprised how nice atmosphere is. The bowling venue I know look a lot different, this one looks more like a bar which I liked. Since I am bowling newbie I can't say too much about that but the bar is great. They have a good selection of draft beer and you are allowed to bring drinks (not food) to the bowling area. Unfortunately I missed the food, but it looks amazing from the pictures on Yelp.

vbO4ZppKRL4cYeq_ud8PPQ.review_text: I came here for brunch on Sunday and it was easily the worst brunch I've had in San Francisco. I had the fried chicken and waffles and my friend had the yogurt with quinoa granola and a bruleed grapefruit. The chicken was overly greasy and had a strong smoky flavor. This did not pair well with the bland waffle (the loads of butter on top didn't help either) and the fake maple syrup. The yogurt and quinoa was fine, but didn't go well together. The grapefruit was edible after taking off the thick layer of sugar.  The bowling was great, but not enough to merit a 2 star review.

RjXoItFdpC2juYjgu9sfUw.review_text: This review should probably be on Foodspotting  because I'm writing only about their chicory salad, but I don't have an account there and anyway I didn't take a picture.  They have the most amazing chicory salad. You have to try this. It is bitter tasting and dressed with smoke oil, which I had never had. The chicory is big, soft leaves that look like lettuce and are chewy like kale. They are bitter and I usually don't like bitter things but they also taste like bacon so somehow it all just works. I don't know how to describe it. Anyhow, just go there and get some. You won't be sorry.   They also have a butter lettuce salad with chunks of avocado in a lemon-mustard dressing that I enjoyed. And fried oysters, and mussels in bone marrow broth. My date liked that, but I didn't. We *all* loved their s'more brownie dessert. I almost didn't eat the bottom of that because I hate graham cracker but it turned out to be more of a toffee-cookie sort of experience so I was about to order a second one but I'm only just getting back into my smaller pants again, so I decided, maybe not.

3PBv7qP7MU7JX-HQ561W6A.review_text: Best food and service that you will ever find in a place with "bowling" in its name.  GREAT  burger (with part of the $ proceeds going to local non-profits). Shrimp fritters that are mostly shrimp.  If you get the fries, and you should get the fries, the smoked chili aioli will ruin you for any other  fry condiments.   Great booze and even better bartenders.  Lindsay, Susan and Will- you guys are the best! The whole staff is pretty kickass, when you get down to it.  (No, I don't work there and I'm not sleeping with anyone that does - this place is simply doing it right ). Nice but quiet outdoor area where you can bring your bike in with you.  Restrooms would be better with paper towels along with the dryer. That is my only complaint.

-3RDox7tSilod2ntyXs2AA.review_text: Mission Bowling Club hosted my 30th birthday party last weekend and they were absolutely wonderful!!  The planning and execution were both top notch and I could not be happier with the results.  Jillian, the Events Director, was extremely cooperative, thoughtful and engaging in the planning of the event.  She helped plan the menu (asparagus bruschetta, beet crostini, french fries and fried chicken), the number of lanes needed, the open bar for everyone and what was most wonderful was how flexible she was able to be on the number of guests as it varied between 30-40 in the final days (landed on 32).  While not present for the party, Molly stepped in and helped execute along with Nadia, our wonderful host that was assigned to our party.  Nadia was amazing!  We had 32 guests and she was extremely attentive to me and all of our guests for food and drinks.  She was also very good keeping me informed of when we met the minimum costs and wether we would like to keep the tab running (kept it open of course!).  The food and drinks were all delish!  This was my third time at MBC and only the first time I was able to actually bowl!!  It was a great time and I would highly recommend them to anyone looking for a fun venue to host a similar affair.  Thank you!!

YbZg36FoMgkKcTEPae5siA.review_text: My friends and I have stopped here several times just to hang out in the front patio for drinks and food. I hear the bowling prices are a bit on the higher side. The drinks are quite delicious including the non-alcoholic ones. We've ordered appetizers before too which were better than most bowling alley food.  The staff are super sweet and helpful. Perhaps maybe one day I'll bring some folks to bowl. I dunno though because there are much more reasonable bowling alleys in my area.  It's not very noticeable from the street. In fact, someone asked us where it was since we were going to the same place we just told him to follow my friend and me.

W0Y8ttpKctH8wIQJP4z6sw.review_text: Great fun, great people, terrific time. Eat somewhere else before or after.

N_IJg4Oy-OoYtzIE8Mxq9w.review_text: Doorman was a hipster douchebag ( more on that later)  We went to this place for a team event and I couldn't have had a worse time. I will never be back to the place again.   Pros-  * Um, it's a bowling alley nearby my place.  Cons-  * As I was walking in I noticed a guy sitting on a barstool outside the place smoking a cigarette and talking to a girl on a fixed gear bike. I thought he might be checking IDs but he didn't look at me and didn't say anything. As I walked by him, this self-righteous hipster loser had the audacity to say, "Yo chief, where do you think you're going?" He then looked at the girl on the bike and was like , " what does he think i'm doing, sitting here just for fun?" and laughed. I told him he was an idiot to think I was going to assume his little hipster jackass self was actually employed by this place. Strike one - what a F'ing douchebag   * The bar staff was over-extended. They couldn't keep up with the amount of people that were at the bar. It took over an hour to get the drinks the 7 people with me ordered. Not really the fault of the bar, more of an issue with a lack of resources.  * We ordered the "world famous Mission Burger". Who gave it this moniker? It was fine, but nothing amazing.   * You are not allowed to eat in the seats where you're bowling. You have to sit on a bar away from the regular seating? Ridiculous.   Overall : I will always give a place a second chance, however this places "I'm better than you attitude" has turned me off completely. I wouldn't be surprised to see this place go up in flames when one if it's staff accidentally set fire to their wax mustache while smoking their Benson and Hedges cigarettes.

cZ32kzf_M5ZCpxq2y0vYDw.review_text: Here's the deal. This is a happening place. The ambience is edgy Edwardian meets pop art Star Wars. The food, service, and beverages are equally as impressive rendering an A +++ score.   The experience is worthy enough to justify the journey through the sometimes shady Mission neighborhood.   Fair warning however...  This place was hipstered out BIG time.  If you do not like the Runaways/ Belinda Carlisle circa 1976 punk look you may be a tad uncomfortable with the crowd.  I was born in the 1970's so I have never understood Generation Y's obsession with distressed cowboy boots, Laura Ashley jumpers, weird half shaved heads, and Super Mario brothers.  No matter...   Interesting observations  I observed an ultra-Christian bowling team (Bowling for Jesus) battle a team with matching fighter pilot jump suites and handlebar mustaches. I also observed a male bowler sporting a 1980's tail and mullet.  (Extremely random)   Bottomline: Worth checking out even if you don't ride the Apple or Google shuttle bus to work.

B_-hfjqjuaF0ScIrBYh9iA.review_text: The only reason I gave it 3 starts was because after 2 hours of bowling we had dinner in the restaurant. The wait staff was great and super nice. They were attentive and very sweet. The food was bar type of food which we all expected, but what we did not expect was the over-saltyness on everything we ate... The fries were so salty it made the burger taste salty... So I think next time I would go bowling, but not for dinner... I will say I would go back for brunch sometime too... Overall it would receive 4 stars for bowling, 4 stars for service and 3 stars for food. Just stop salting everything so much... Please...

vubm_oo7r2dp39lwGztgCw.review_text: I've been here several times for take out.  The food is consistently very good.  So if you're looking for a great place to eat in the neighborhood, you can't go wrong eating here.  Definitely give it a try.  I've just had their fried chicken and salads.  Looking forward to trying the burger.

LJVqYAAkezBZFSdcicv0pg.review_text: Mission Bowling Club has become my goto first date spot in the city for a few reasons: 1. Even if the date isn't great, I still get to bowl so that's a win. 2. Really nice cocktails and fast bar service. I like their Bourbon Reviver or the Ruby Fruit if you're looking for something more sweet. 3. You can reserve your lane online up to a week in advance, so no need to wait. 4. It's usually a pretty lively crowd, even on a Tuesday night. 5. Also, bowling in the Mission. Did I already mention that?  The one negative is that it can get kinda pricey with the lane rental for an hour running you $55 and $4 per shoe rental.  Well, that's pretty much all you need to know. In case you're wondering, I've been hitting the 140-150s pretty consistently lately, which I consider awesome for a guy who doesn't know what he's doing despite watching Kingpin and The Big Lebowski about 100x.

kKhE9CsizWb7PEEg301s9w.review_text: Best burger of my life, hands down! Grilled onions, monterey jack, and caper aioli; cooked medium, and without any of the side toppings available on the plate. The shoestring fries were tasty as well. My friends and i split a plate of the home fries, and we agreed they were magical. Tasted as if they had been fried in bacon fat.  The cocktails were also quite good. The staff was really nice, especially when i had to change my reservation from 8:30pm to 9. There are plenty of items on the menu that looked good (i sampled my friends' ratatouille and chicken sandwich), but i will definitely be back to try a bunch more.

eDalDbIeIeJlZrSW-cpIIA.review_text: AMAZING BURGER!    That's what this review is for. Not for the bowling. Not for the service. Not for any other food item. I am giving this place 5 stars for the burger alone. Yes, it is that good. I eat a lot of cheeseburgers, too (for example, I will easily go to Five Guys for lunch, In-n-Out for dinner, and Jack in the Box for drunchies).    First off, you could argue that the patty is the best pure beef patty in the city. Many places will mess around with the cuts of beef that go into the patty, or they will mix in bacon, onions, etc, and those are all great. But there is something really special about a burger seared in tallow (beef fat). Very rich and a lot of meat, too.    The bun is excellent as well. It is very soft and holds up well with the large, greasy patty wedged in between. The burger is garnished with caramelized onions (which are a little sweet for my liking), Jack cheese (could be good if they had cheddar or American, as well), and caper aioli (almost tastes like a high-end Big Mac sauce).    The fries it comes with are about as crispy as they come. I suspect they use cornstarch spray to achieve this. They are delicious.    All in all, for $15 (with fries), I am very impressed. I don't know if I would say it's the best burger in the city, but I find it hard to believe that there could be one out there that is significantly better.    I didn't get a chance to bowl, but there were not many lanes. The bar area has a cool vibe to it, and the service was pretty good. We also tried the dry-fried pork ribs ($12), which had somewhat of a curry flavor to them. They were great, as well; surprisingly tender for being fried.

ekaQsTZ_PlxR88xtHgZtcA.review_text: Disclaimer: I am such a non-bowler, that I have in my history, a *sober* incident of having actually let the ball slip out of my hand behind me . . . yes, rolling *away* from the lane and pins and toward the snickering onlookers.  However, I do think that I've embarrassed myself in enough bowling alleys to be able to say: This place is seriously cool. And not just in a hipster way (although several reviewers would beg to differ) - I've definitely seen families, straights, jocks and squares here, all bowling away and having a grand ole time.   Best is to reserve ahead of time, as there are only 6 lanes. Further recommended is to eat and drink here: drinks are tasty, not watered down (as they are at other bowling alleys).  The breakfast egg & sausage mcmuffin thing is the bomb.  Hamburger & fries are solid as well.  You can even go and just drink or just eat - but why not do these AND bowl, I say?! At a recent baby shower here, the staff very graciously cut & served our homemade cake, making it seem like we weren't putting them out at all.  Do go - you may just want to think twice about sitting in the seats directly behind my lane . . .

K-IwyVCopU0fuxToo_aHVQ.review_text: The Mission Bowling Club is the s***, hands down the best bowling alley in SF.  First off, its much more than just a bowling alley.  The bar, with the giant 1080 p massive projector, is by its own right a properly stocked and entertaining establishment. Their cocktails are reasonably priced, delicious, and they usually are playing whatever Bay Area sports team is playing at the moment.  The bowling alley, while small, is a great time. The guys (n girls) that work the bowling operations are always going out of their way to make sure you have a good time n that you get in as much bowling as you can. The prices do go up later in the evening. Refer to the description of the bar, for awesome distractions while you bowl... i.e. projector n beverages.  And last but not least, what completes this well constructed puzzle is the dining room. The kitchen, now run under new head chef Chris Kiyuna, is some of the best food for its price in the city. The chicken roulade is exquisite, cooked sous-vide style with browned crispy brussel sprout chips... you had me with sous-vide. The burger is superb, and understated perfection of properly prepared meat, caper aioli, and a toasted bun.   I had to give this next nugget of information its separate paragraph-anything deep fried out of this kitchen is golden. The fried chicken is the best I have ever had, and the mushroom poppers are bomb.   In a nutshell, the Mission Bowling Club is a must. Even if you're visiting for a couple of days, I would recommend spending a day in the Mission, and some quality time with the one and only MBC.

GC7x8kBNx-gVyCCxck6VFQ.review_text: First time there for a friend's surprise bday party.  It is basically a bar,  bowling alley and small eating area.  We were one of two groups there for a surprise bday party and management proactively insisted that we couldn't yell surprise or blow those silly bday horns when the bday person walked in - because that 5 seconds of noise would disturb the two people in the tacked on dining area.    It seemed pretty irrational.  15+ people select your BAR for a bday party and you tell them they can't make any noise.  We are a very quiet group, not loud drunk bar go'ers on a Wednesday night.  The manager wouldn't even discuss it and was far from enjoyable to talk to upon inquiring.  Hilariously, part of her brief explanation is that they were worried about Yelp reviews.   The only way I can see it making sense is that they charge $15 for a hamburger, every other entree is ~$20.  Guess they are trying to earn their money less on the groups drinking and bowling, and more on food.   Burger had have a metric ton of salt in it.  Wouldn't recommend it.

ElvZfHPHe5g-Ib61IPXvDw.review_text: This is a really tough review for me to write because I love Mission Bowling Club, and have always had a great experience there. I've experienced their brunch, dinner, and bowling, and normally it goes off without a hitch. (Reservations are clutch for busy times on Thursday and Fridays.) The bar is well stocked with generally quick service, and the bartenders know their way around most of my favorite drinks. They also make one mean Bloody Mary.  So why the negative review? I went to brunch at MBC yesterday; two people at my table ordered the chicken and waffles (usually delicious). I have a hard time finishing full portions, so I split mine with another diner at the table. The table next to us had 7 people who all ordered chicken and waffles, so the kitchen was a bit behind on the dish. The other two dishes my table ordered came out about 20 minutes before the chicken and waffles, which would have been fine if the three of us who ate the chicken and waffles didn't all immediately get sick.  My guess? They felt bad about being behind, rushed the order, and under cooked the chicken. The toilet was my best friend yesterday and today, and I'm not sure if I can ever order more of their friend chicken. Which is such a shame because it's usually delicious. So if your orders are coming late, make sure you ask them to cook the chicken thoroughly. Your stomach will thank you later.

PvBmRN4suldo06Kcz2-vcw.review_text: A friend and I got a reservation pretty easy on a Thursday.  Food was very good and service was quite fast.  We had the talked about burger, fried chicken and pork belly.  The burger was super juicy but could of use a bit more seasoning but cooked perfectly.  Probably one of my top 5 burgers all time.  Chicken as well, needed some seasoning both in the meat and batter.  Chicken meat to me had some citrus/lemon notes?  Weird but maybe it was a part of the brine?  Addendum in Yountville, best fried chicken ever.  Pork belly wasn't the star of the night but enjoyed the jalapenos and pickled/grilled cabbage?    To the bowling...There were huge crowds at the 6 lane alley.  The two guys working the lanes were cool ass shit.  We signed up at the start of dinner at 7:30 and they said it might not be ready until 10:15.  Well we finish dinner in an hour and was going to cancel the bowling because we weren't going to wait that long, but Fred did some magic and had us in at 9:15.  Awesome dude!    Nice bar.  Great outdoor patio.  Will be back to try the corn dog and the burger again.  And bowling of course!

pme7GsuU86rKc78DMoyBIQ.review_text: Such a gem in the mission to get your bowling fix with drinks and good food. Really cool lounge area and bar plus staff is really helpful and kind as well.

FGkq_yMe53te4_o2f6JVpg.review_text: Come for the bowling but stay for the food.  We went with a group of 6 people.  First thing you should know is that when you make a reservation for dinner your doing just that.  Making a reservation for dinner.  If you want to bowl that is a separate.  You can not eat on the lanes just drink so be aware of that.    We started out with the fried chicken, crispy pork belly and the home fries.  The fried chicken was the best.  I don't know what the coating was but it was tasty and the chicken was really moist.  The crispy pork belly did not excite me.  I have had better. I had the mission burger and it lived up to all the hype.  It was cooked medium rare and was seasoned perfectly.  I would go back again just for the hamburger.  One of my friends had the short ribs.  It was ok.  The other had the jerk pulled pork, one had the fried chicken.  I tasted them all and with the exception of the fried chicken the burger was hands down great.  For dessert we had the Smor'd brownie and the cinnamon crunchy toast.  They both underwhelmed me and I would pass on them next time.  This was a really fun place with a great atmosphere.  It is certainly worth the trek (and it is one)  I would head over here again if given the chance.

5RCcFwMRghhw1wMhnZY5RA.review_text: I feel guilty even writing a review about this place because its such a hidden gem.   Popped in here on a convenient Thursday evening for a little late night meal and some bowling. We only had to wait about 45mins which was perfect, so that we were able to grab a bite to eat.   We ordered the Mission Burger with some fries.(A++)  We were told the Burger was voted one of the best, so we HAD to try it. I must say, it was pretty damn delicious! The bartender/manager was absolutely one of the best parts...He was SO nice and informative of his knowledge of the area and the Bowling Club itself(Mike/Michael...I believe!?!)   This will become a favorite local hangout when i am in the area. Great place, good people and GREAT food!!

-IRA58GTq9LLA2MXD24DfQ.review_text: I came here for brunch yesterday (Sunday) with my fiance. It was absolutely astounding. I can't say enough about the food. The whole time we were there, we kept saying "is this possible? How is this so good? That kitchen is so small?". I think they have a magical vortex in the back where delicious food comes out somehow, because, oh my gosh. It is indescribable. We split the french toast and the chicken and waffles, and holy crap, it was all good. So good. The french toast was eggy and delicious, and the chicken was cooked to perfection - the chicken even has some chili sauce cooked in it...oh my gosh, heavenly.   The waffles are cornbread waffles, which are not my favorite, but they go brilliantly with the chicken and chili, and are a great pairing. Also, we had the best mimosas we have ever had in our entire lives here (and I love mimosas). They were just...perfectly balanced. Usually you get a mimosa and it's good, same old same old, but these were just... mind blowing. Everything was. I am absolutely bowled over (haha see what I did thar) by this place, and will come back again and again! Love love love. Our waitress was also lovely, helpful, and wonderful! Seriously. If I had a million stars, I would give this place all of them. If I only had to eat one meal for the rest of my life, I would want that fried chicken.   Also, the bowling is really fun. :) As a native Bostonian, I obviously prefer candlepin bowling, but this was still ok. The food clinched it for me, though. Stellar food and great drinks, and some fun stuff to do? I am in. I am so in. Can't wait to go back!

eKUGKQRE-Ywi5dY55_zChg.review_text: You know that guy that's great on paper? He has a double masters, a promising career at one of the Big Fours and spends his free time volunteering at The Food Bank... He seems so perfect until on your third date at Balboa Cafe (which he suggested), you find out that e-v-e-r-y-b-o-d-y knows him by name. You then overhear from cougar #16 that he has mommy issues and has went through the entire cougar town and then some. Guuurrrl, I hope you kept that cookie IN the cookie jar! This is how I felt about Mission Bowling Club (MBC). After being featured on a handful of foodie publications and being praised as having "one of the best burgers in SF", I found it to be sorely disappointing. They might as well be featured on Fieri's Triple D because that's how overrated I felt the food was. MBC has been on a radar for quite a while since I bookmarked it after reading that the chef came from Coi and the Front Porch. I recently found out that this chef is now at Ichi + Ni Bar; overseeing the izakaya kitchen. I revisited Ichi last week and the sampling of izakaya item(s) we had were stellar so I think it's safe to assume that with his departure and the slew of recent bad reviews that MBC has gone downhill. With a small, focused menu with less than 20 items, everything should be executed well; theoretically speaking of course. Unfortunately, almost everything we had at MBC was poorly executed. I'm not much of a fried chicken person unless it's KFC (the Korean kind) but I do follow the 7x7's Big Eats List. I'm completely baffled at how MBC's Fried Chicken (3 pieces - $10) got on that 2014 list: bit.ly/1fp8CKp. They should rename it to "deconstructed fried chicken" because upon biting into, all the batter fell off the chicken like an easy beezie smashed on one too many patron shots. We also ordered the Deviled Eggs ($8) which were dry and tasted like leftovers from a tea party. Another round of disappointment came with the much raved about Mission Burger ($15 + $1 avocado) which was on 7x7's Big Eats List last year: bit.ly/1fnr0xi. I read that MBC uses a "granulated" patty modeled after the Heston Blumental technique. Blumenthal's, (UK chef of The Fat Duck, 3-Michelin stars) technique of "granulated" patty involves grinding pre-salted beef, aligning it in parallel rows before forming into a roulade (log), and then slicing into patties. The result is supposed to be a more tender patty because the grains are running in the same direction as you bite into it. I'm sure the original Blumenthal burger is perfection but MBC's execution fell really flat because what resulted was an incredibly salty meat puck with a texture of a tightly packed sausage: bit.ly/1huBaPU. I like my beef patty to crumble into my mouth. This didn't. Sure, it was a big, half pounder burger but who cares when it was so overbearingly salty that I could barely finish half. Three of my gfs who also had the burger agreed that it was way too salty. The super crunchy fries (double fried?) were otherwise good albeit greasy. The best thing of the night was the S'more Brownie ($8) and I don't even like brownies: bit.ly/1bJkqGp. It was super chocolately with a nice crunchiness and oooeey goooeeyness from the torched marshmallow. Disappointing food aside, service was painstakingly slow. Our waitress was really sweet (and so are the bouncers) but the kitchen had some major timing issues as it took over 40 minutes AFTER finishing our apps to get our burgers. Our manfriends sat at the table next to us and were done in an hour but we were left still waiting for our food. Mind you, we were the second table to order and the couple next to us who took over our manfriends' table received their food before us. What the heezy?!?! Beware of the wrath from the female waitress with black, shoulder length wavy hair. As we were gathering up to leave, we stood near the ramp, and with a huff and a puff, she rudely said, "Guys, I'm going to be coming through here all night ok!?!" basically saying to GTFO of her way. My bad, your hipster majesty, we should of rolled out the red carpet for you. MBC is a large venue for the Mission standards but tiny for bowling alley standards. There's an outdoor patio in front, a bar area with communal tables, a small dining area and an upper loft dining area. There's only 6 [short] lanes for bowling which you MUST reserve. Our group came in six different cars and parking didn't seem to be an issue unlike the more central part of the Mission where hot spots like Beretta, Lolinda and Foreign Cinema are located. TIP: If you plan to eat and bowl at MBC, allot at least 2 hours to eat since service was as slow as a herd of turtles moving through a pool of nutella. So slow that the girls missed our bowling time slot. MBC is not 100% at fault though since our manfriend organizer thought an hour would suffice for a group of eight to eat. Sorry J, but not all of us finish fast like you.

kyqtO6okDapzZBekubM1xw.review_text: We read that this burger was a competitor to the Zuni burger and the likes. Not even close. Overcooked and underwhelming.  We're used to small, overpriced cocktails but these take the cake.  Not coming back. Ever.

hOPhxpCvB2bKjRoMG16OCw.review_text: Came here for a celebration, and had a great night! I actually didn't even have a reservation for either dining or bowling, but still managed to get a lane on a busy saturday night.   The food is mediocre - perhaps a bit too greasy for my liking (but what can I expect...I'm at a bowling club, right?). There were more empty tables than I would've expected, so I'm guessing most people come for bowling and drinks/apps. The prices are fair (~$15 for a burger with fries...) for the location.   There are only 6 bowling lanes, so things can get busy during the weekends. the four of us bowled for 1.5h, played roughly 2.5 games and spent $25 each for bowling including shoes. Being able to enjoy drinks made bowling a thousand times better (you can drink on the lanes, but can't eat).   All in all, we had a great night and I would definitely recommend the place to anyone wanting to enjoy a more adult version of bowling.

djxnI8Ux8ZYQJhiOQkrRhA.review_text: True story: I took bowling instead of gym class in high school. Back in the day, I used to be pretty good. Top score ever? 199 (just a pin short of 200, might I add).  Fast forward many years and I find myself at Mission Bowl, throwing gutter balls down the lane. I guess what they say is true, practice really does make perfect.   Even if you suck at bowling, a few games here is a lot of fun. Great space, nice bartenders and a special treat in SF. The only other bowling alley that I'm aware of in the city is all the way in the Presidio, so great business idea.

wkNUVy8LK28OytucC8MASw.review_text: Just the notion of combining bowling and creative cuisine under one roof merits praise.  Then when you toss in the avant-garde bowling-themed decor and an overall vibe of retro-recycled chic, you are hitting a strike on nearly every frame.    Our lively Irish waitress was extremely pleasant and engaging, although we did wait just a bit of time for her to show up (note: the scene here for diners is frenetic but not intrusive or rushed).  This gave us time to get acclimated to the menu and offer silent prayers that our lanes would open up before the cows came home (alas, no...see below).  Dinner was a far cry from the hot dog, cheese fries and fountain soda feasts of my bowling-obsessed youth.  We started with a big, salty bowl of "home fries," somewhat pedestrian on their own but instantly convertible to a can't-put-down finger food when paired with MBC's avocado-edamame dip (we had to ask what combination of ingredients was creating the creamy-earthy goodness).    Hot on the heels of the fries came a seven bean salad served over mache and whimsically strewn with edible flowers and crunchy fried chickpeas.  A perfect, fresh, flavorful palate cleanser, and a great tee-up to the hearty roasted chicken.  I used to think ordering chicken at restaurants was a cop-out decision that steered me away from more inventive options -  not here.  This chicken is roasted in a sublime fashion that produces impossibly moist meat that melts in your mouth while exploding with the tanginess of pickled mustard seeds.  The "crispy skin" perched on the bird when it arrives is the proverbial cherry-on-top, a guilty pleasure that adds yet another satisfying dimension to the dish.  We didn't get to experience the bowling after all, but the gentle thud of bowling balls on hardwood and pins hitting the deck was a great soundtrack for the evening.  And everyone seemed to be having an awesome time and not taking the actual bowling too seriously - no slick, off-duty PBA bowlers in this joint.

xoOVvRGOFG3hwzz19F3Y9w.review_text: What's better than eating and bowling? Eating and bowling as a work event, that's what! The food was good, and the bowling was fun, so this event was right up my alley.  We had the mushroom lettuce wraps, beet crostini, french fries with a smoked chili aioli sauce, and fried chicken with ranch  The chicken and fries, along with accompanying sauces, were really good. The lettuce wraps and crostini were interesting, but didn't really do it for me.  The food on it's own, or the bowling on it's own, wouldn't have merited a 5 star review.  But it was just the combination of it all, plus the good service that we received, that made for a 5 star terrific good time.

EGvptPOz6SDKdxvbeqQ7Vw.review_text: Very cool spot. More of a bar with pretty good food and art than a bowling joint. Mini gastropub slash art gallery with bowling lanes?  There are 6 lanes so you have to reserve a spot. I actually bowled my highest game here which was awesome.  Beer wise it has a pretty good selection and the prices are reasonable. Green flash on tap makes me happy plus all their Belgian selections were nice They also have a good assortment of liquor like hangar 1 vodka.  Food wise, there's a decent selection. From corn dig sausage to bug burgers to pork belly. I was disappointed by the pork belly since the serving was small but it was good.  The spot is cool and if you really want to bowl, this probably isn't the place unless you can get reservations which we did. Great bar spot though!

fMUBsXKl8GYHTj5cqAbvBQ.review_text: Went to Mission Bowl to celebrate my sister-in-law's birthday on a Sunday at 4pm during family bowling hours.  The food was great and the upstairs is perfect for a large party.  The management however is terrible.  We had a great server but about 30 minutes after we got there they came upstairs to tell us that minors cannot be in the bowling alley after 7pm.  No problem.  However, over the course of the next 2 hours they told us 6 times.   No issue leaving at 7 but it was completely annoying and insulting frankly that they continued to remind us like a broken record.  If you don't want kids there, make a no kids rule. But don't invite families in and then ruin the experience by continuing to remind them that they have to leave as soon get they get there.  We will not be going back, with or without kids.  (Update) The Events Manager followed up today to apologize on behalf of the staff for the unnecessary multiple reminders of the 7pm policy.  We appreciate her focus on good customer service.

tFpue3FaJQWKmVRm2vFq_g.review_text: Had a great time here. We got a dinner reservation at 6 on a Saturday night but since we weren't able to reserve a lane, figured we might be out of luck for bowling. Luckily, since they keep some of the lanes open for walk-ups, we were able to put our name on the list before we sat down to eat, and the bowling desk guy came over and let us know the lane was ready just as we were finishing up dinner.  Dinner was tasty, and the veggie burger is definitely worth a try -- it's a chickpea panisse (chickpea flour formed into a patty). Fries and salad were good too. Cocktails were fine, and they do a couple beer flights too.  Bowling was great! The music was excellent, and the room wasn't too loud (or quiet). The scene was low-key but fun, and it wasn't too crowded. Rental shoes were surprisingly un-gross ((maybe I'm just used to really old, gross bowling shoes?).

9fe41Vmw245Eho1PghHHKw.review_text: Came here for brunch, and was so excited to see a menu that had some original things on it - or a more modern twist to brunch options with fresh ingredients.  My brunch companion ordered the chilaquiles - a deconstructed one with fresh guacamole. It looked beautiful, and she loved it.   I had the pork belly dish that came with two poached eggs, potatoes, saukercraut. It was beyond perfect balance of flavors and textures. I was so pleased.  Their coffee is Four Barrel - makes sense, the place is right around the corner. Their cocktails are innovative and smart. Also, super tasty.   Service was friendly and didn't lack in anyway.   Overall, a great experience! No need to bowl, but there are a few lanes. I'm excited to try dinner...or maybe throw the ball down the lane.

NiuqkrQQAh3B_HQMhb5wsQ.review_text: This place has a great ambiance. And you're paying for it.   On the whole, prices seemed 25-30% higher than I'd see/expect elsewhere. While its sorta okay, because it's so nice, it sorta also sucks.  Things to know:   During happy hour, burgers are cheaper @ $10. After happy hour they're $15 but  they come with fries, which are $6 if you buy separately. So if you plan on having a side, it's *cheaper* to come after happy hour. (I wasn't feeling too happy when I realized this.)   The cheap beer was super skunky last night, and more spendy then at similar hipster hangouts, so it was also a poor deal.   The chicken sandwich is okay, but the chicken on a stick is better.   The burger didn't look to great to me, but tasted excellent. Really good.   Friends got the mushroom fritters, which were heavy dough balls- I'd skip them. Blegh.

rAcQ-AcLwFm6DxiiCkXOYA.review_text: I'm leaving a one-star because I don't appreciate businesses that discriminate against people with families.  Mission Bowl, even though they serve food, prohibits people under 21 even on their patio during brunch -- even if the patio is totally empty!  I have been here a few times for parties including parties I helped organize.    But recently I went back with my wife, my son and a friend on Sunday while they were serving brunch.  We walked into the patio area which has a couple dozen tables, of which only 2 were occupied.  We went to sit at one of the many unoccupied tables and were immediately approached by a waitress telling us to leave and pointing to a sign we had missed saying nobody under 21 is allowed.    If they want to discriminate against people with families, I guess that's their business decision to make (unless it's illegal which it might be).  But if they make that choice, then they deserve to suffer the results of that discrimination too -- and that includes me telling everyone I know not to patronize Mission Bowl, telling my company to stop having parties there, and letting people on Yelp know about their policies.

ES12kMOR5fdoEnSXvxE0qw.review_text: Amazing little bowling alley. Friendly staff. Outstanding food. Immaculate bowling lanes. Clean bathroom. Fully-stocked bar! Overall WOW!  Friends and family celebrated several birthdays at once. We had two lanes for two hours. Kids and adults had a GREAT time. Everyone loved the food. Some loved the adult drinks. I loved the VERY STRONG coffee.   The ambiance inside is very cool, but the sidewalk outside is anything but. The neighborhood is a bit rough with a meth-prostitute wondering back and forth on the sidewalk.

mVxg_vBXcUAAQJ03uHxiIQ.review_text: They're trying, but bad service and a couple kitchen gaffes left me feeling burned.   No waitress for over 10 minutes after we sit down. I finally catch a server and ask "are you serving this table?" She says "let me check," and then it's another 5 minutes before she comes back and confirms that yes, she is serving us.   Drinks were slow and some were forgotten (later brought out after a reminder). Two of our four food plates were well behind the other two. My companions seemed to like their food OK, but my eggs benedict was almost totally cold and was served on raw untoasted english muffins. Maybe next time.

JVHlFff199O9R0JjKaE0ew.review_text: Came here on a Wednesday night for a friends birthday. For just five of us it took 2 hours until we could get a lane so we had some overpriced drinks and ate dinner. Everything was slow and over salted. Cool atmosphere and good for small groups of hipsters but it's way too small and overpriced.

gaPnh6koItDnhZbciG5GPg.review_text: Some things in life are just meant to be paired together. Peanut butter and chocolate. The Splash Brothers. Bacon and...everything. Mission Bowling Club does the same, combining a bowling alley and amazing food to create a truly unique experience. A bite of the burger and sunchokes instantly washed away years of trauma inflicted by the food provided at childhood bowling alley birthday parties (parents: don't let your kids eat hot dogs of unknown origin).   One unexpected treat - The Nightmare Before Christmas was playing on a big screen the night we were there. Watching Jack Skellington, Sally, and Oogie Boogie dance to the music playing in Mission Bowling Club was absolutely brilliant.

2Ul7JOPv4PwAwhmF0WlUag.review_text: We came here for a work function and it was superb. We didn't have reservations and with some heavenly intervention we got two lanes right away. Its $10 an hour to bowl and $4 to get the shoes. Not bad at all. I expected it to be worse.   As a group we decided it was very necessary for team building purposes to try (pig out) on the cheeseburger. And boy did we bond. We bonded over how stinking delicious it was!!! Its big, succulent, tasteful, and downright amazing all around.   I love it here. Great spot. On the small side so it may be harder to get lanes on those busier days.

O9iVmgS_hPtNd887LDBctw.review_text: The fact that this place is a bowling alley seems incidental.  With 6 lanes, it's not really designed to be the focus of the venue either.  I've been a couple times and really just enjoyed the food and drink, and the comedy of watching hipsters try to bowl in skinny jeans.    Their food is pretty good gastropub fare, and I am huge fan of the burger (get it medium rare), and their fried chicken is not bad either.  The first time I went, I enjoyed some good beers on tap and a decent cocktail too.    Fun place to hang out with a couple of friends and think about bowling. I don't really like bowling so it never advances beyond that stage but I am not complaining.  It's just kinda cool that we have hipster versions of everything now in the Mission, including miniature golf at this point!

WDsr8RnPqbceR3s2yZYr3Q.review_text: Yeah, it's as cool as it looks from the outside.  You walk in, and you can grab a seat at the high tables behind the bar, from which you can see, holy cow, people bowling in the Muthaeffing Mission.  Somehow I felt like this should be occurring about 2000 miles east of here in the Midwest.  They have a number of great things on the menu.  At the server's suggestion we tried the mission burger which was dripping with wonderful juiciness, plus the "asparagus bruschetta" which really should be called the "miso with egg yolk magic dish" because that's the sauce that does all the work on this one.  That was my fav and I highly recommend it - and it's vegetarian!  They also have a decent beer selection including Old Speckled Hen, a cream ale  (it has creamy head like a Guinness).  They also let you do a "beer flight" which is 4 mini glasses for $12.  I love that.  I'll have two, thanks.  See you again soon, Mission Bowling Club.

426IAYOuscDp4KzKa1_mcg.review_text: I decided to have my birthday here last year after having tried the spot just weeks before I was impressed by the quirkiness and easiness of this place . I'm pleased to say that it all came together on my birthday and it wouldn't have been right if it hadn't been at Mission Bowling Club.  MBC is located in the Mission area just blocks away from the Southern Brewing Co. and has plenty of street parking, too. Inside MBC is a good-size full bar, seating for dining, a dj booth, and about 6 alleys for bowling. The spot does get busy so please do make rezzies via online. MBC also has outdoor seating in which you can bring your dogs and enjoy the hipsters that pass by!  One downside is to MBC is the short food menu, however, it does have a couple of mentionables which include their infamous burger and fries and MBC even has a brunch menu worth checking out. . I do also have to bring up their specialty cocktails, which is great if you're planning to do a group thing (like I did), MBC has a full bar and offers all types of beer on tap!  Overall, the main reason I did book my event here was because it was great for all ages and allows everyone to have a good time whether it was just enjoying the burger, bowling, having a cocktail, and/or even just enjoying the lively scene- MBC was great for all these things!  Thanks MBC for celebrating my birthday with me and making it a happy one!

B6xxXHebsWphZe4_uXi3pw.review_text: We came for the fried chicken - and it did not disappoint. The chicken was tender, juicy, and crispy. The waffles were a wonderful cornmeal waffle, served with maple butter!   The sangria and Bloody Mary were a perfect to go with it.   We will be back to bowl...

s4eGhA7wluf_g-4ib9s_4w.review_text: My shuttle use to always pass by this place and I really couldn't tell what it really was.  The word "bowling" is on the building but there are also some contemporary art pieces and outdoor seating.  Doesn't really seem like the typical run down bowling alleys that I know, and after checking it out, I realized that it really isn't typical.    Mission Bowling Club is like a hip high-end bowling alley with art pieces inside and with surprisingly good food and drinks.  (Not just beer).  I was quite impressed with the the atmosphere of the place and the tri-tip sandwich that I got wasn't half bad.  I also got the fried chicken and it was displayed very nicely.  It was crispy and decent.  Can't say it's the best fried chicken I've ever had but definitely good enough for me to say "Wow....food and drinks are pretty good here (at least it surpasses all the other bowling places)."  It's a good hang out spot.

C1ccV5ednpSJSL5NKibCOw.review_text: The fried chicken is one of the best I've ever had. The crust on it was so crunchy it was unreal. My first thought was someone used crushed up biscotti to make this :)  Lots of flavor in this super moist chicken that I never even touched the ranch looking dipping sauce.  The burger was also great. Juicy, ground on site patties that stands out from other burger joints. Two thumbs way up!

pauOTA3dvD944S6IhDAiBQ.review_text: This place is so new, you can't even tell that it exists if you research the address on Google Streetview. But it's there and so are the crackheads! I came here for another friends birthday and we all had a good time!  There's a really awesome patio that fronts the bowling alley. There is plenty of space to lounge with drinks, or park your bike off to the sides of the patio. There is one person at the front who checks IDs, sorry kiddos, this is 21 and up. There is a bar on your left and seating to your right as you enter the actual building. The lanes, approximately 6-7 standard regulation go from the rest of the front to back. The building appears to have been an old warehouse, and there is this awesome skylight that runs over the top of the bowling lanes. The decor just feels right for a bowling alley. As a group we tried to guess how much it cost to build this place up. I had researched in the past how much it might cost to start just a club/bar and you usually need about 1.3m in capital to make a decent bar and take over the plot of land. But this obviously had to be a lot more considering that they put in a complete renovation, installed multiple bowling lanes. I took my guess into the 3m range.   I was really starving, so I made the rudest call and ordered food before the birthday girl arrived, and made her really jealous as soon as she arrived. It's okay my friend still hates me :D I got the 1/2 lb. Mission Burger and ate it really slowly in front of my friend. I pointed to the patty after the first bite, to show her that they actually cooked it Medium Rare, just the way I liked it. The bun was so tasty too! I also proceeded to eat my shoe string fries very slowly and also demonstrate that they were slightly spicy! My friend, the birthday girl was pissed. Who's an asshole? This GUY! That's okay eventually her corndogs and fried chicken came out and I dropped my jaw. They came out on platters skewered by their own sticks and propped up on the plate like they were part of a mid-evil castle. I also had a payback porter to wash everything down.
