The waitstaff was really helpful and courteous. They were not overbearing at all, but I can't say they the were doing anything exceptional. There was a $5/person cost for cake cutting since we brought our own cake to celebrate my friend's birthday. What a phenomenal deal!  We didn't get to try out the actual bowling lanes, but maybe another day! I would definitely return to this place, the environment is low-key and relaxed, exactly what you want for a weekday night.

FIkDUA_Dsjs-pKtuqFf8bg.review_text: I was really happy when I went here.  The bowling is pretty good, the local crowd seemed great, and I would have been super happy with the food in an upscale restaurant, let alone in a bowling alley.  It was crowded; you have to be okay with not a whole lot of personal space.  And, with any crowded young group place, it was pretty loud.  But, I'll be flat out - I haven't had this much fun bowling in years and years.  I would strongly recommend this to anyone who's got a hankering to throw rocks at pins.  The prices are pretty high, but in my opinion, they're worth it.  Good luck parking though :(  I mean yeah, it's San Fran, just, leave some time to find something, and expect a couple block walk.  Five stars.

5i2Uwd20tuR4RM5mq7RX3w.review_text: We booked a large party (14 people, 2 lanes) in advance, and arrived a couple minutes early.  The guy at the desk had given away one of our lanes to two people, leaving all of us on one lane.  That lane didn't even work properly.  The pins failed to reset, and the same guy who was running the desk was supposed to be running back to do the maintenance.  The balls were poorly drilled, and the bar service was nowhere nearby.  Fail.

DkFR-AE68Nr0jRR8mKQmlA.review_text: Killer establishment!!  Had no problem getting a lane to bowl each time I've went.  The staff was pretty chill and the place was less pretentious than I expected.  One major perk was that the pins always reset with no hassle.... I've never been to a bowling alley where the pinsetter didn't freeze and you have to reset numerous times or go grab someone.  Prohibition Witness beer on tap was choice.  Only drawbacks were that there are always private events happening and that it is pricey.  Overall helluva cool place!

JJNdVimvX83J9Qu-IXh_Jg.review_text: This place rocks! Especially the bar. Lindsy behind the bar is the perfect mixologist and uses unique ingredients like her own home made tonic.  Really, really good. They have a good Central Coast Sangiovese ON TAP! The place is really fresh and original, the staff friendly and helpful, and the foods good. From Vegi burgers and steaks to pork and unique small plates.

HorQ90eiUPfnesQlIraaJA.review_text: Now I had the Danny's burgers back when he was making them in the Doi Loch Supermarket for $5/per, so it is a little painful to see them here for $15.    But such a cool spot in SF that everyone should check out, a real hidden gem in the Mission.  We were passing by on the way back from Charles Chocolates and thought we would stop for a quick bite (Thursday around 7pm). Without a reservation we could only eat at one of the bar tables (bonus points for purse hooks under the tables!). We spilt the fried chicken appetizer and the pork loin entree and 1 beer total was about $30 pre tip.  The chicken was yummy and a pretty good portion for $8. crispy and spicy, sorta like fried buffalo chicken. The pork was just okay - but I still love this place. I would love to come back for Brunch and/or a fun night of bowling & snacking with my girlfriends.   Decor is fantastic, just the right touch of classy, quirky and cool.

5GqtMUFZwn9oxeLBT22ViQ.review_text: LOVE this place! I've never been anywhere like it -- trendy, fun and vibrant bar and restaurant scene with cool bowling?! Yes please. They also have an adorable outside patio where you can enjoy a cocktail and an appetizer while you wait for your group's turn on the lanes.   After having come here once, it is now a constant thing I suggest for group activities or out of town guests. An easy, super fun and lively place to enjoy some quality time with friends. Couldn't recommend more.

e3xe2-HZrYElon__E7GGTQ.review_text: Forget about bowling.  I come here for the solid $10 cocktails and the great burger.  Been solid the last 3 times.  The fried chicken is a little too greasy.

4RlzFohEgBdFXUGoqvpZqQ.review_text: *On our quest to try 52 new places in 52 weeks.*   You are going to fight me on this. You are going to say this doesn't count as a place to get drinks, food, or coffee. BUT we did have drinks here, it's new, and we've never been, so I am keeping it on the list., damnit! At least for now.  We came here last Saturday for my friend Lia's birthday. She had reserved the lane ahead of time so we didn't have to wait. Clean, hip, and new. And amazing art on the walls to boot! The rentals for shoes seemed cheap and to be honest I can't tell you how expensive the lane was to bowl, but the hour sure went by quick! The waitress was SO nice with her cute little top knot and was very accommodating when some extra drinks we didn't order were put on our tab. To be honest, everyone in the place was celebrating a birthday s0 it had a fun, celebratory vibe. I will come again!

LgqaNO1mXwWncSfmSn2AtQ.review_text: Decent beer 'n bowling. Pop-y tunes make you want to dance. Plus, nice staff.

6kWAL8wWRAe17ARc78Ay9w.review_text: When I was invited out to the city by some friends for bowling, drinks, and food, I had a bad feeling that it was going to be Lucky Strike. I hate Lucky Strike and everything it stands for. Happily, though, my buddies insisted that Mission Bowling Club was not Lucky Strike, and even better, had a menu conceived by Anthony Myint from Mission Chinese.  And Mission Bowling Club, friends, was a good time.  Yes, the wait was long for an alley, but the food and drinks were good and kept us busy until it was time for our turn.   Drinks wise, I wound up drinking Manhattans the whole night. They were well prepared, though maybe a bit too light on bitters. For food, my group snacked on the fries and the awesome pretzel with the lardo infused mustard. I couldn't resist trying the burger, and it was pretty damn delicious, especially the caper aioli.  The bowling experience itself was fine. It's not the best, most polished alley I've ever been to, but I kind of don't even think that's the point. It's a great combination of food, drinks, and good times.

ZBLZIOrO3DZJzDFlFO-bJw.review_text: This place is a winner. I've been to Lucky Strike (In Hollywood) many times and while nice it is crowded and the food is mediocre and drinks expensive.  Mission Bowling has excellent food, good drinks and has a relaxed bowling vibe. The food is so good I'd go there for the food alone.

0c_GFwm7lkj_4avuwWvicg.review_text: I really like the food and how intimate this place is. It was such a great place to bowl and also the brunch on the weekends are not bad after all. The location is a little sketchy but other than that, i think i want to come back and bowl again.

awoGUpad0Ng6ftpkywwVgQ.review_text: NOT a full service bar, actually no service at all.  I can't believe how lousy we were treated the day of my birthday! My boyfriend made reservations a month in advance. When we checked in with the hostess they had two booth tables for us at opposite ends of the dining room! Even though we had reservations, they would not sit us together, they would not put tables together and the tables that were together were needed for "walk in business'. I guess the idea of walk in business was more important than guaranteed business with reservations.  By some miracle a table upstairs had "opened up", which is amazing seeing as how we already had reservations. So we went upstairs, when the rest of my party showed up, once again they wouldn't allow us to put another table on the end because it was a "fire hazard" and they wouldn't let us sit at a larger section. Our waitress said, "This is what's it's gonna be, so deal."  I guess on some level I can understand all their policies, but it wasn't just that, it was the way they spoke down to us.The house manager refused to speak to us, she made her hostess do all the dirty work. On the way out, the doorman actually told us to "Keep it down!" It's an effin bar, on a Saturday night! What a dick!  As a native to this city, I still have trouble with how much the mission has changed over the years. The fact that a stuck up establishment even exists in the mission, still gets to me. If I wanted to be talked down to I'd go to Pac Heights or even the Marina, not the mission. I will not be going back.

EU5cmRY4EJy2O0Ca87y9NQ.review_text: What's not to love?   It's corny fun but in a cool atmosphere. Great space, like a converted airplane hangar or something, with very courteous service, decently priced pitchers of beer, good music, tasty food, and oh yeah, BOWLING.

XcuwFBs8RN5MQeFVjQMHJg.review_text: I have yet to actually bowl here, but the food is amazing!!!   (How often are you likely to see a bowling alley given a review like that, eh?)  The dry-aged beef burger is out of this world, and the veggie burger ain't half bad either. The chef here was on Food + Wine Magazine's "Top 40 Under 40" list, and it really shows.  The youthful hipster atmosphere and the fact that you're eating in a friggin' bowling alley are just icing on the cake.

s81VRLqYFEpXPIQtGx2mnw.review_text: I was skeptical when told that this place has the best burger in San Francisco.  We ventured here to put it to the test.  I must admit that the food here totally caught me off guard.  This isn't your usual bowling alley fare!  We had a miso crab appetizer that was delicious, and the burger was indeed juicy.  I don't know about THE best burger in San Francisco, but overall the food was tasty.  Didn't get to try the bowling though!  TLDR: Surprisingly fancy food for a bowling alley -- try their burger!

EhIolH5byA5_IO7VVZyAPQ.review_text: Such a fun place. The place has a retro feel to it but the lanes themselves are very modern. (I've been to places with old-fashioned lanes and my already poor bowling suffered as a result.) There's a decent selection of drinks and comfy leather couches to enjoy when you're not up at the lane, and all of the staff we encountered were incredibly friendly. It's a bit pricey, but worth it for a large group.

I1-7pV9Xas-7-_RZgl_Z9Q.review_text: Overall, this was a great dining experience.  Good beer list, everything we ate was actually delicious.    The Fried Chicken was out of this world - perfectly cooked, crispy, and well seasoned.  And, surprisingly light.  The dipping sauce was a savory sauce with herbs.  Seemed like a cleaner take on ranch dressing.  I ordered the Pastrami Buns.  I was hoping that they would be similar to a similar dish I'd had at Momofuku Noodle Bar, and sure enough, they were spot on.  The Pastrami was a little dry, but as a lover of burnt ends, they were spot on for me.  Delicious sauce and I believe pickled shallots made this a really enjoyable  and again light dish   My buddy and I shared a side of fries.  They were perfectly seasoned and crispy.  It seems like fries are supposed to be hard to mess up, but when a place nails them, it is worth pointing out.  Service was attentive and helpful.  All in all, have to recommend.  Will be back.  Perhaps bowl a game or two next time as well...

7kPR3NAhl72EGbUU1h9FOw.review_text: While we didn't actually bowl, we did get to enjoy the atmosphere. They have 6 lanes, and plenty of space to carouse. The Bar tenders were good, if a bit easy to distract with all of the pitcher orders flying at them.   We really wanted to sit upstairs, but apparently that is for diners only - fair enough.

FucUIUbYeZ4LSwfVoRf8Ww.review_text: Came here with a group of friends on a Sunday.   This place is super cool and cute - I love the loungey entrance, and the sounds of people bowling is strangely nice to hear while hanging out eating.  So, no complaints about the service. But wow the prices here. $10 cocktails. I opted for a beer, and I also ordered the vegan burger. While really delicious (really, it was a great vegan option - especially the sambai sauce), it was TINY. For the price, it felt like half a sandwich and a salad. Fries extra, as always, anywhere.  Good food, prettyyy crap prices. But it's a pretty chill place, I guess!

jteCb0GYOLVEl7IcZbmI0g.review_text: Though I made a reservation for six when we actually had seven, the hostess was very willing to accommodate us in whatever way was most comfortable. This alone earned them a few stars. The food was good. The atmosphere is trendy and welcoming. The downside is the lack of people to call beforehand to figure out situations like having a group of seven when the reservation must be made online.

McnAn0w_Fff4ikbWJXIVww.review_text: great burgers and bloody Marys... fun place to hang out with friends

xNtpzroZKi9WtTgW3rJeXw.review_text: The cocktails here are great. The food is good. I've never had a good bowling game.  The 2 or 3 times I went, it was too crowded to get a lane. Totally understandable. Can't fault a business for being successful. Go Mission Bowl.  The next couple times I went I reserved a lane ahead of time. Both times we had at least one frame incorrectly scored per player. Sometimes it'd mark the wrong number of pins, other it's skip a frame, other it'd miss a roll entirely.   Now I think every game is more fun with money riding on it. Gambling is an important part of my being. Having to debate scores, or adjust scores on the little machine after drinking was not fun. Wagers were left in dispute.  The last time I went the machines were working perfectly. Everything was scored correctly. We had just finished the 8th frame when our hour was up and we were booted off the lane. No ten minute extension was granted.  So that's 5 or 6 times I've been, and not once was I able to have a problem free wager on a bowling game.   I really want a bowling alley in the mission, but I'm going to try lucky strike or go back to Seabowl.

K1wCbP90gxqACyz2w6fu0A.review_text: Super cute, super hipster. Love the outdoor covered patio (dog friendly!) and decor inside. Make a reservation for a lane if you want to bowl (or not! the bar is pretty awesome). No opinion on the food, as I didn't eat. Just t up with some friends to bowl, drank and run!

__05rytNjsye9MBhqB0DMA.review_text: Having to always wanted to try the burger, I was excited to eat here. My bestie and I shared the deviled eggs and my main the burger.  The deviled eggs were not what I expected. It yolk portion was mixed with chickpeas. The eggs were colored a brownish color, assumed it was soy soaked.   Not really to my liking. I wanted something savory and not healthy.  The Mission burger was good, but not 5 star good. I ordered mines rare, so rare meat was a 5 star for me. But everything else with it was just average. Maybe I should have ordered it medium rare to let the fat melt. But I would assume the seasoning would still be pronounced in rare meat.  Not so for me.   A good place for cocktails and beer, plus bowl. Maybe I will come back to try the burger again.

cCeCQxErE9ToaQQBEVFuFA.review_text: Food is awesome here, and the bowling is lots of fun. not a whole lot of room between seating, though. Pricing seems reasonable. I did enjoy the theme better at Presidio Bowl, it was like being in the late 80's.   Clean, and good beer with lots of choices. What we ordered: Sausage Corn Dog Fried Chicken Jerk Pork Shoulder Sandwich w/ fries  everything was absolutely delicious, unique and with a fun presentation. patio seating best choice.

JDbnOECGbsUPd8Etg_O7Pg.review_text: Sat at the bar. Out bartender Peter gave us some seriously great customer service. I'll definitely come back.

9rdz74ub05wudQdtOPQjaA.review_text: Yes, get the fried chicken. Mixed drinks are okay but I felt they were small.

zst5ol5eBsx-Uz6wfKDzAA.review_text: This is a great place to bowl.  Super fun.  Hubby and I ended up here and decided to bowl for an hour.  I don't remember how much it was, but it was reasonable i'm sure or i would have heard about it from him. Ha!  The drinks were average price too.  I love that it's small doesn't feel like a giant loud bowling alley.  Good times!

lFdcgrMkHCmvTjMEw4CVDQ.review_text: $55/lane for 5 people.. Pretty pricey.   But well worth it.  Food is delicious and the burger is just as good as everyone says it is. (Been on my bucket list for months!) It's HUGE so you can totally share the  burger with a fellow meat lover..and devour their french fries because they're super  good too (extra crunchy and delish). Their mushroom fritters are great too--they're like hush puppies with ground up mushrooms and  spices.    Service was superb--always  got my water filled up on time and was checked on multiple times throughout finishing my meal.  Brandy (waitress) was super  nice and the two cute boys working the bowling lanes were friendly.   Totally worth checking out.

rVs5Ttf3TcjX952G289c9w.review_text: Unfortunately we didn't get to bowl here, but the five stars is really for their service. I accidentally left my wristlet here the other night, and within seconds of us leaving, one of the waitresses ran after us! I'm super, super grateful for this!  Also, their drinks are pretty strong and tasty!

4qA3ZTymquyb8Fl2ye-sqw.review_text: Wow, what a treat to run into a place without knowing anything about it, and totally have a great time with great friends and great food. The first thing that caught my eye was that it is beautifully decorated. Then I saw the bowling area. What??? Big leather couches instead of hard chairs? I'm in. What a great place to hang out with friends or your special someone. Well, if the beauty of the place wasn't enough, the food will knock your socks off. Our waitress recommended the brunch menu. First thing I noticed was the Waffles and Fried Chicken? Huh? Ok, I'm a NorCal girl. I guess this a SoCal thing. (Never heard of it).  It sounded weird so I went with the Mission Burger which sounded so good because I was STARV....VING!!! When the table next to ours got their food, yup, one of them ordered the Waffles and Fried Chicken. It looked delish! Guess what I'm ordering next time I come here. That's right,  the Waffles and Fried Chicken. Back to my Mission Burger. Let me just say there's a reason MBC is known for their Mission Burger. It was (in not so many words)....the best burger I've eaten. Finger licken' good. Oh yes, I will be back again. Can't wait. And just in case you wondered....the drinks aren't anything to sneeze at. I had the 'Strawhide" , let's just say, two of those are enough to get you in a good mood. I'll be back for sure.

SsfjEoKdt3Q6szxL2sAGZw.review_text: We sat at the bar and had some small plates and cocktails before catching a performance across the street at ODC Theatre. It was great. We can't wait to go for some bowling. Food was promising, and cocktails were awesome.  Fried Chicken 5/5 So good. So good. So good.  Elote 3/5 Hubs really like it (sauce and corn), I just liked the corn.  Fries with chili aoli 4/5 Fries were thick, aoli was good. Wanted em a bit more crispy.  Clover Club Cocktail 5/5 Delicious and light.  Gin and Small Batch Tonic 5/5 Awesome tonic.  Corazon de Melon 4/5 Had a hard time tasting the melon, but it was still delish.  Kingston Mule 5/5 Refreshing.

awmRirDC7WWig6R07XZ_oA.review_text: Food is delicious and comes out quick. The burger is thick, juicy, tasty with good hard buns. Fried chicken comes on a stick with three pieces with homemade ranch - this too is delicious.  I come here to eat, but wouldn't mind bowling either. oh, and hitachino nest white ale - my beer of choice.

M9FL-chYhMA4nZpmTbWIZQ.review_text: Review based on brunch experience: A few things were jarring about the Mission Bowling Club.  Firstly, enjoying a sit-down meal with friends is interrupted by the sounds of pins crashing.  The food's not your stereotypical finger-foods, i.e., greasy chili cheese fries and tacos, so it demands a more "upscale" dining atmosphere that can't be had by bowling.   The brunch menu is limited.  Especially to vegetarians.  My boyfriend and I aren't that strict (we'll eat seafood), so I inquired about the Dungeness Crab.  It's the one savory item that the Mission Bowling Club offered that didn't contain chicken or red meat...and the waiter informed us that they didn't have it.  I was in a state of disbelief, considering it's a weekend morning, we were the first party there, dungeness crab is in season, and its BRUNCH time!  I don't know who's doing the ordering but that chef needs to get it together.   My boyfriend orders the French Toast goo.gl/U0bLp (because that's the only vegetarian dish on the menu, albeit sweet), and I, being super hungry, put-out, and not into sweet entrees, end up with the Loco Moco goo.gl/AkC8U.  As much as I love Hawaiian food, and as much as this Loco Moco was flavored well (it's hard to f*ck up Loco Moco...), I was upset that I *had* to eat meat (even if it was short rib) just so I could have a meal with the rest of my friends here. Geez.   Since bowling ain't my thing, and the menu didn't win me over, I probably won't come back here.  Ever.

eUmVXP9UnoWtz9NSBwY4jA.review_text: One of the hottest new ventures in town, Mission Bowling Center fills a void that's been missing in this part of town - a great place for food, drinks and entertainment. The scene is hip but not pretentious, the staff friendly despite being swamped since day 1, and I can definitely picture myself drinking one too many cocktails on the patio on a warm afternoon.  I've been to MBC three times so far...once to bowl, once for drinks and a third time for brunch and have yet to be disappointed. Some highlights: the fried chicken and waffles (whereas the chicken is INSIDE the waffle - genius!), the blackened salmon and, of course, the Mission Burger. Not in the mood for a (well made) $10 cocktail? Belly up to the bar for a $3 PBR and some great people watching. $15 Mission Burger too rich for your blood? Come at happy hour when it's only $10.   All that being said, it begs the question: is Mission Bowling Center a bowling alley with kick ass food or an awesome restaurant with a side of bowling? I'm not quite sure but I think I'll have to keep coming back until I figure it out.

5_gbaJzM9w_oAvLf7ARBWA.review_text: When did bowling become an event you had to save for? I thought this was the sport of soggy hot dogs and slightly chilled bud lights, a sport where your rental shoes are the fanciest piece of clothing you're wearing.   THE VIBE:  Honestly, it's not that bad. the space is cool, right off of Mission and 16th, a little unassuming until you go in. There's a small bar, food items, and about 7 lanes. It all looks like it's going to be a fun night of bowling and drinking with your friends, until they quote you the price. $70 for 4 pairs of shoes and 40 minutes of bowling. 40. minutes. That's absurd. with the pitcher of beer being $26, we were looking at a cool $100 for 40 minutes of entertainment, which is about 1.75 games, if you play quick. we had to go back and pay for 10 more minutes to finish our second one.   That's pretty much the issue: It's too expensive. Make the trip and go to Daly City to one of the crappy bowling lanes down there. Authentic, cheap, a little sticky, and totally everything bowling is supposed to be.

w7RP1MZad3YO7Vjgp3s3Dg.review_text: Came here on a Friday evening after 3 stops in mission and ordered the fried chicken and burger. The chicken was super crunchy, moist and very tasty. The burger was great as well. Fun vibe , not crowded at all , easy to get a table. Will definitely come here again and try the other things in the menu.  TIP: There's no cover charge.

m46mnqdQg_lUGJJz4vokVw.review_text: Great bowling, the beer selection was killer, the fries were crisp AF, and the atmosphere was perfect for a Friday night with friends--- HOWEVER....... the burger was simply devastating. Really soured my experience.   They didn't have bacon (da fuq?). The onions were tasteless and I'm pretty sure they came out of a can. The patty didn't taste/feel grilled... it was literally a loaf of meat that gave me an eerie lunchroom vibe. Finally, omfg, the worst part---- there was an egregious lack of bun given the enormity of the lunchroom loaf and I am utterly shamed to say I broke down and had to use a fork and knife. You guys fail, I mean help me out here.

6_VkzelWeSHzjTVDlGl-Ug.review_text: FOOD: Burger real yummy soft w the cheese mmm  Chicken tenders - a lil too extra fried but still good  Fries - pretty crispy n seasoned really good with the thousand island or whatever orangey color sauce   SERVICE: Workers are nice   ATMOSPHERE Casual chill hip loungeish mini bowling alley w high bar tops, bar, mezzanine. Went here once for a Christmas party and it was good for that. So it's good to know it's rentable and they do a good job with service and food, and reserved lanes.   12.15.13

mzv3adVXMorJ92n1HkEp5Q.review_text: Fantastic pork chop.  Was just waiting to bowl again but that was seriously one of the best pork chops I've ever had.  I can't believe what a gem the mission bowling club is.

sHq44LP-ZuSnHO0QiHafgQ.review_text: All right you damned hipsters! Live it up while you displace the locals with your little bowling balls, and your idiotic, first world "what should I drink in the ghetto that might make me appear to fit in?" problems. Jamon B. If you want a drink, go to a BAR.  Calbe B? It's "the s***" because it's the ONLY BOWLING ALLEY IN SF, if you can really call it a bowling alley. I just wish you'd all drop the balls on your little Tom's clad feet so that you can't maraud up and down Valencia street like spoiled children on your bicycles any more.  Earthquake, baby. Earthquake! *crossing my fingers*

r0uY6pozqbZ2GtK0XCpBug.review_text: i would likely rank it higher if i could ever get in again. i went 2x when it first opened and now you have to plan like its french laundry to get in on most nights.

E0hnzH2Kx50pYjIOhMxfuA.review_text: 7x7 100 Best Things To Eat In SF Before You Die 2013  #57 Mission Burger at Mission Bowling Club  Bun-unique, provided good supporting role to the the dish, would have liked it toasted better  Burger-great crusty sear leaving a good juicy burger, seasoned relatively well with a good meaty bite  Sauce-caper wasn't pronounced, compounded the greasiness of the dish  Grilled onion-well done, sweetness accented the dish well  Fries-felt I got way too many crispy ends and not enough substance  Service was great, was not expecting that at all  Overall Thoughts  A unique burger technique yielding a good solid burger that's worth trying but be warned its on the heavier side

AMKrPRWJMBAt671UD86YMg.review_text: Mission Bowling Club offers a fun concept! Indoors is a small bowling alley with the bar and some tables for food, and outdoors offers a few tables for brunch. My groups of 4 made a reservation at 12 on a Saturday, and sat outside. I would recommend that - just to enjoy the good weather and also, carry out an easy conversation less disrupted by the sound of falling pins!   After glancing at the menu, three of us decided to get the chicken and waffles (the fourth initially wanted to do that too, but thought he should be different and get the loco moco).   All I have to say is, get the chicken and waffles! That is the stuff dreams are made of. The chicken was fried to perfection, the battery crispy and the chicken juicy. It was complemented by the waffles, which were savory (made with corn instead). The best part though, was the maple butter. Sweet and creamy and whipped so lightly. Amazing. We all ate in silence for a while as we enjoyed our food. My friend who had the loco moco enjoyed his dish, but by the looks he was giving us, I'm sure he would have wanted the chicken and waffles instead.  We also all got drinks. I got the corazon de melon, which had a mixture of juices and Cointreau. It was flavorful but a little strong for me.  Overall, a great experience! Our server was very friendly as well, which was a plus. I'll definitely return!

YnHf1BPFjfj3kK_i1AC4rQ.review_text: MBC is my new favorite spot for burgers~ the mission burger is so delicious and goes great with a pitcher of squid ink beer from SPBC down the block~ if you wanna bowl show up early since the lanes here get taken up pretty quick~ MBC is a fun spot to hang with friends or just to grab a quick drink or snack~ parking is bad and neighborhood is sketchy so watch yourself when in this area.

oIPeq87rRzUMrOTbKzWfAw.review_text: I kind of wanted to dislike this place after hearing that the lanes aren't full regulation size.  But, I've become a regular; however, not for the bowling.  The bowling is fun but pricey.  The food is the main attraction, followed closely by great drinks.  Their burger is probably up with there with my all time favorites in The City, perfect bun, big patty, caramelized onions.  The fried chicken appetizer is extraordinary.  I had given up on finding perfect fried chicken, but, low-and-behold!  Thank you!  My date ordered a salad with watermelon in it.  NOT my cup of tea, but it was amazing!  I'm looking forward to having brunch in their great outdoor patio soon!

5gbkhlWANGVzQYi_0m3vOQ.review_text: Mission Bowl is so nice, it's like Beretta for bowling. Apparently, it's cheaper than Presidio bowl, but more expensive than Lucky Strike; the food is great and the cocktails are tasty. The fried chicken was extra crispy but too lemony for my liking, I would instead recommend the burger which won several awards I hear.  About 5 lanes, and they rent per hour, so bowl fast and make a reservation now!

5X7FMNE7YZ0WcKxrDz8FEg.review_text: This place is awesome! It is luxury bowling, with big leather couches and ambiance lighting. I stumbled across it during an evening stroll. We went in to get drinks and check out the place. Apparently the food is really good. The staff was great, super nice and fun.  Can't wait to go back with a big group of friends to bowl.
